I need information about the Exclusion Zone.
Yeah, the fucking Zone. She's the only one everyone's interested in right now. More precisely, how to make a profit out of it, and how to stay alive. In general, choose about what to tell you: mutants, factions, locations, anomalies, or artifacts. My information is absolutely reliable and beyond any doubt....
Tell me about the Zone locations. .
I'm interested in the existing groups in the Zone..
Information on known mutant species would be very useful to me.
What do you know about anomalies spotted in the Zone?.
What information can you give me about known artifacts found in the Zone?
The Exclusion Zone now stretches south of the Chernobyl nuclear plant and covers an area of 40 square kilometres, bounded by a triple perimeter ring guarded by the military content of NATO countries as well as Belarus, Ukraine and Russia. Its entire territory is divided into several sectors where there is less anomalous activity compared to the rest of the territory. The rest of the area is considered impassable due to high radiation levels and the presence of giant anomalous fields. However, after some particularly intense releases the Zone may change its usual boundaries, as well as shifting the anomalous fields within itself - thereby opening up previously inaccessible areas. And to some, on the contrary, it erases any known accesses. It was the way it was in 2011 when Limansk sector was finally opened, while generators' area north of ChNPP, better known as Tesla zone, was cut off by an impassable anomalous field. There are also natural obstacles that prevent stalkers from moving deeper into the Zone. This is the infamous Radar-a psi unit controlled by the Monolith clan. It's the Radar that separates the Northern Zone from the Central and Southern. I can tell you more about known locations in the northern, central and southern parts of the Zone. Separately, we should highlight the complexes of secret laboratories which exist within the Chernobyl Zone. True information about them through skimpy and incomplete. So choose what area you want to know more specifically. .
Tell me about the northern part of the Zone.
I'm interested in the southern areas of the Exclusion Zone.
Tell me about the central sectors. .
What do you know about the underground labs?. .
The Northern Zone is unfortunately not well researched, due to the difficulty of accessing it to date. In the past, that was probably the biggest mystery of the Zone - what's behind the Barrier. But never mind. Today we can talk about the existence of the following sectors of the Northern Zone. This is actually Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant - the heart of the Zone, to break through to which many sought, but managed only to unity; generators or Tesla Zone, as it is also called, a small area north of the plant - according to one of the legends it was there, rather than at the plant occurred the second explosion, Pripyat City - a former town of power engineers servicing Chernobyl, is now a ghost town, controlled by the group Monolith; The territories adjacent to the western outskirts of Pripyat are a not safe area, where there are complexes of the "Jupiter" plant, the village of Kopachi, and Yaniv Station; Zaton is a vast swampy area of the Pripyat River floodplain, located to the north of Yaniv Station; and Sulfur Cornon, the northern boundary of the Zone, located further from Zaton. In general, I'll choose - I will tell more about them. .
Tell me about Chernobyl. .
Epicenter of both catastrophes, both long ago and common knowledge, as well as the present one, no one fully understands. The atmosphere is infinitely dark and frightening. But it is not the lack of life, the empty squares and abandoned machinery, the dust and debris rising in the wind, the howling of the beasts, or even the occasional blaze which no one puts out, because no one is even here, but rather the inexplicable sense that there is some sort of observer. There is someone else, a hostile and inhospitable host! It is as if with every second you spend here you sink deeper and deeper into an otherworldly timelessness and, at some point, there will be no escape. .
I'm interested in the Tesla Zone.
One of the most mysterious places in the Zone. Includes several lab-type buildings. In the centre of the sector is a very strange concentric-shaped anomalous formation. There is no detailed information about what is really going on in the Tesla Zone, as most stalker expeditions have gone missing. According to one version, after Strelok managed to get to Chernobyl, some members of the group O-Consciousness has been moved into the complex, where it operates to this day, guarded by adepts of Monolith. .
What do you know about Pripyat?
The western and eastern parts of the city are separated from each other by impenetrable anomalous fields. To cross from one part of the city to the other requires the use of underground utilities, teeming with mutants. Eastern part of the city: the intersection of Druzhba Narodov Street and Kurchatov Street. Among the strategically important objects there is only a small river station with the adjacent building of "Pripyat" cafe. It is an ideal place for setting up a fortified point, as from the roof of the cafe the whole of Kurchatov Street is shot through, while from the roof of the railway station Druzhba Narodov Street is also shot through. Additionally, in case of simultaneous seizure of the "Prometheus" cinema building with the adjacent music school, from where the entire centre of the city is under fire, virtually the entire district is under control and it would be extremely difficult to dislodge the enemy who has entrenched on these spots. Among large buildings where the enemy may entrench themselves the city hospital with the outpatient clinic MSCh-126 and Pripyat Secondary School 1 in the northern part of the district, as well as a complex of hostels in the south, connected through the building of the canteen "Vstrecha". The western district of Pripyat includes the main streets together with the park area where the famous Ferris ring is located. There is also a sports complex, which offers access to the Chernobyl nuclear power plant. To date, much of Pripyat is controlled by the Monolith faction. .
What can you say about the vicinity of the Jupiter factory?. .
Located to the west of the outskirts of Pripyat. The key facility in the area is the Jupiter industrial plant. Officially, before the accident, the plant was a branch of the Kiev plant "Mayak" and produced rollers of tape drives for household tape recorders. In reality, however, the plant worked for the Ministry of Defence and was engaged in the development of advanced weapons. Direct transport links link the factory to a transit and trans-shipment depot in the south-west of the area and to a concrete factory in the north-east. In addition to the general industrial infrastructure, there are cooling towers in the northwestern part of the area that supply cold water for technical purposes to both plants. Also present in the area is an abandoned S-75 surface-to-air missile system in a modern variant, Volkhov, which controlled the airspace within a radius of 40 kilometres. Representatives of illegal armed groups have set up a large camp in the station building of the Janov railway station. A full-fledged trade in armoured suits of various classes and weapons, both domestic and foreign-made, has been established. There is a small repair shop. Two opposing factions, the Freedom and the Duty, control the area simultaneously, and an armistice agreement is in effect within the station building. There are also small bases of the Rasvet and Mercenary factions. The research group occupies a mobile bunker in the immediate vicinity of the Janov station. The area is heavily populated by mutants, and is one of the most dangerous areas of the Zone in terms of mutants. .
Tell me about Zaton.
Zaton is a hilly swampy area in the area of the dried-up bed of one of the tributaries of the Pripyat River with various outbuildings and boats, cutters, barges and dry-cargo ships sunk to the bottom. A few abandoned farmsteads can also be found in this area. To the north lie the former ladders and the famous Preobrazhensk? bridge. The only safe place is Skadovsk, where there is a shaky truce between factions. It is distinguished by the presence of a large number of so called Archianomalies such as the Claw, the Sosnovodub, the Circus and others. Therefore, these places are considered very rich in artefacts, so the main factions found here are neutrals, as well as bandits trying to control them. Occasionally the Dawn Clan's vagrants, as well as mercenaries, drop in here. Mutants are often found here, but still their population is lower than in other sectors. .
What else is North Cordon?. .
This is the northernmost point of the zone its top gate. In essence, this place is a bit like Southern Cordon, the only difference being that it is more dangerous in every way. Anomalous activity is rather high, but gradually decreases towards the northern boundary. Mutants are more common in the dense forest belt. There are more artefacts than in Southern Kordon, but many fewer than in other parts of the Zone. The military have a great influence here, and even have a well-fortified base and several large checkpoints. Stalker clans have learned to survive in the neighborhood of the military without causing each other much trouble. There's also a base here for a very mysterious stalker clan called the Enlightenment, about whom little is known. Frequent visitors here are also stalkers of the "Last Day" and "Dawn" clans. Occasionally a few wild gangs from Zaton come to the area, but they try to leave as quickly as possible. Also, here are the decaying remains of several large villages, the dilapidated hulks of a factory, as well as a small military town. .
The southern territories of the Zone are the most settled by stalker clans and simple loners. They include the vast Swamps, the Southern Cordon, the Dump, the Agroprom, and the Dark Valley. These territories are under the constant control of one or the other stalker group, and often change hands. In general, there is a constant war of interest here, whether it be the "Duty", "Freedom", bandits or the military. If you want, I will tell you about all sectors of this part of the zone.. .
Tell me about Kordon. .
Pretty pretty scenery, but a very nervous environment. Military mowing down everyone who passes their roadblock. Stalkers quarrel with the gangsters from the clans of "Black Slugs" and others, and they are trying to rip off any passerby, or just slap, so that the weapon does not rust from inactivity. The local fauna survive in their own way too, pecking at whatever comes within sight. The notorious Sidorovich hangs out in the basement, bargains for a bargain basement, so even the seasoned folk and unhatched greens pay him a visit. Not far from the railway embankment settled neutral on a stinking farm, you can also drop in and sbagririvat, if relations are benevolent. In general, very lively and crowded place, this forecourt of the Chernobyl nature reserve.. .
Tell me about the Bogs.
A very ordinary bog with reedbeds and boggy swamps, nothing outstanding. Another thing is that it's rather unpleasant to run into mutants in such thickets, because one can easily get stuck in these very groves, saturated with radiation. However, even without help of monsters to disappear easier than a darn thing. There are no signposts at all. Remembering the paths is very difficult. The only thing that can attract here in general, is the abundance of anomalous fields, and hence the artifacts. The base of the Clear Sky clan was also located here. One could drop in for a light and take a break from the road. Discount the hard-earned goods. Renegade Clan and Blackslug thugs also frequented the area. Neutral loners and members of the Last Day clan also occasionally wandered into the area. After the death of the "Clear Sky" faction - the territory of the marsh was occupied by bandits from different factions. .
Spread the word about the Dump.
Technical dump left over from that very first disaster. Youngsters tirelessly dig through mountains of radioactive waste in search of something survivable, and generally saleable. They call themselves diggers. Mad criminals plunder without scruples. They control all vital activities and take the cream off all events. Here their base is in a huge train shed. You'd better either shoot to kill or pretend to be a lover of country chanson. The second option benefits from the opportunity to earn easy money shooting crows. Dusty earnings. In other words, this dump is a very dirty place, and the inhabitants are accordingly. It is not known who heads the local gang now, and there is no one who particularly wants to know. They now sit in their hangar and only rarely conduct raids. Mainly the Black Creeps and Renegades, who never managed to create their own base, run petty errands here.
Tell me about Agroprom.
Once upon a time, the southern institute building was the base of the "The Debt" faction, who held control of the entire area. Later, the "Duty" found a more suitable place for a base, and the empty complex often stayed in the military during their raids. However,after one of the special services agents blew up there a whole column of "impure" soldiers, they stopped to arrange their resting places there, and as a result the area is now empty and only occasionally occupied by gangsters from the "Renegades" clan, who prefer to hide on the moors only after seeing an army patrol or a large group of stalkers. Central buildings of the complex are under the control of the stalker clan "Last Day". Mutants have scattered here in abundance, but the number of people to shoot them is decreasing. Usually all try to skip through these places in transit to Amber and beyond, rarely stopping to pick up the local wooded hills from the rather large crop of various artifacts.
Tell me about Darkvalley.
Riddled ravines and bald hills, unsightly vegetation and a few imposing grey-looking buildings. A small marsh of radioactive waste in the lowland. At one time there were located here stalkers of clan 'Freedom', after their departure this place was kept under control of 'Bandits', now controlled by breakaway clan 'Bujan'. However, the farms located closer to the cordon, are under the control of "Black Slugs", and occasionally drop in here stalkers clans "Seeker", and very rarely the representatives of the faction "Sin". .
Tell me about Bar and Rostock.
The bar is a location - a conditional border of the southern zone, which is the eastern part of the factory "Rostock". The territory is controlled by the "Duty" faction, which, however, does not prevent the presence here of other stalkers - mainly neutrals. Perhaps this is due to the fact that the "Dolg" strive to attract as many people as possible into their ranks. A loudspeaker broadcasts propaganda material on a daily basis. In the event of an alarm, the same loudspeaker is used to announce it. Mutants are almost absent, anomalies are also very rare and are mostly found in places where the inhabitants of the base wander very rarely. .
The central areas of the Exclusion Zone include the locations Limansk, Amber, Wilderness Areas, Hospital, Militarium, Radar and Foggy Chascha. Choose which one you want to hear about. .
Tell me about Wilderness Territory. .
Located west of Bara, now not under the control of any faction. It's always gloomy and foggy and it often rains. There used to be a rather large factory in the Wilderness, but now it's just ruins. Many stalkers have found their end there - a huge number of monsters breed there. It's rumored to contain something of great importance, so there's always plenty of people willing to try their luck. One can search for an entrance to the underground laboratory, but hardly anyone has ever returned from there, and no one knows what's there. There are also many railway tracks leading to a small station. There used to be a mercenary base here, but now they have moved further away closer to the centre. The most common fighters to be found here now are from the elite bandit group "Alpha Dogs". There are also many seasoned lone stalkers who have come for valuable artefacts. Because of the proximity of the Dolgov base, one can often find members of this group..
Tell me about Amber. .
Empressive factory-type complex, covered in a copper basin of psi radiation. Hordes of inconsiderate stalkers wander aimlessly about, corpses transformed into walking corpses. A small valley, where in the old days there was a lake, but now there is only an unsightly marshy puddle. There is also a fenced field camp of intellectuals, with an iron coffin in the middle, where a scientist is taking shelter. After the big blowout all the bespectacled people have rejoined the wilderness, so there's no one else left except for that grey-haired sage Sakharov, who smokes in his bunker all the time. The perimeter of the camp is scrapped in places by the zombies, but the volunteer neutrals defend the area with such enviable enthusiasm, it is as if Sakharov is turning into a maiden at night. .
Tell me about the Misty Patch.
Huge Woodland, located in the heart of the Zone between the northern areas of the Junkyard, east of the Rostock factory and just south of the Militarium. Rarely do you dare look here, for mutants are teeming with them. True, the forest and a lot of artifacts, but who would go there for them. Sector is not controlled by any faction.
Tell us about the Militaries. .
The last outpost where man manages to dominate the spawn of the Zone. Here it is still possible to sit around a campfire and argue for life with other stalkers. Farther away there are only hordes of zombies and mutants, and such inordinate levels of radiation and psi radiation that no super protective suits will protect them. But here you have to regularly rebuff monsters and monoliths, which almost all burst out of the centre of the Zone and seek to expand its possessions. But such hassles more than pay off, you can already find here such artifacts, which are not even the price. Also over the years so many shrewd stalkers have come here that there is every chance to stumble on absolutely exclusive guns, one-of-a-kind items created by skilled craftsmen. In short, there are a lot of fish in this pond, but it's deep and there are also some very toothy ones. The territory of the former military base is now under the control of clan "Freedom". .
Tell me about the Red Forest.
This is in no way a birch grove flooded with sunlight and white trunks, not even Soviet-era plantings with trees in rows, but a gloomy and hostile thicket with barely discernible paths immersed in perpetual semi-darkness. Any creaks or rustles resonate so strangely that you cannot even tell where they are coming from. Your own footsteps startle you. In other words, all the deepest fears, probably left over from the sad times when man was huddled in caves, are awakened here. There are also many abandoned mines and underground tunnels, where all kinds of unfriendly creatures lurk, and the whole forest is their dinner table, a sort of hunting ground. It's not nice to feel like a living ham. There are several underground mines here that lead to who knows where and with who knows what under the ground. Bandits from the Renegades and Alpha Clans can often be found there. Sinners have occasionally dropped in here. .
Unremarkable streets and architecture. The fountain in the central square, a small river with a nice bridge, wooden pergolas in the backyards, playgrounds, and even a new building with a crane. The standard set of attributes of any small town. The only thing that gives it originality is a huge antenna, towering above all the buildings in the area and kind of forcibly pulling everything to itself, as a vortex of a sinking ship. An unpleasant object. It would be interesting to know what exactly the crew of this ship have been up to. Rumor has it that most of the scientists assholes engaged in various bad experiments in secret laboratories on the territory of the Chernobyl zone, found themselves here, and then along with it kopupitsya at a time when the second accident happened. They were experimenting. Earlier on the territory of this small town almost simultaneously penetrated the "Duty" with the "Freedom", but they either shot each other or were killed by the "Monoliths", in general, neither of them now try to wander here. There was also a rumor that the Clear Sky fighters succeeded in clearing the city of bandits, military and Monoliths, not without help of mercenaries. It was only there that they had also strained their strength. "However, the Monolith also chose to retreat closer to Pripyat. Now here often meet soldiers of the Clan "Seeker" and adherents of the sect "Sin". .
Tell me about Limansk. .
Tell me about the Abandoned Hospital. .
Hospital wards restrain the will and manifest all fears completely already purely instinctive. They are associated with hardship, pain and grief, and total helplessness, because nothing depends on you here. Everything is in the hands of a man in a white coat, holding a scalpel or the edge of a sheet to cover the deceased in the next bunk. Gloomy thoughts come to mind, there's no getting away from it. This abandonment is even more pressing and unnerving, because all the ugliness is still hovering there, not evaporating, eating away at the floor and walls like mildew. The presence of monsters and enemies enlivens the place and makes it less scary. One involuntarily rejoices in the howls of the beast, seemingly deadly, but at least understandable and tangible. The hospital used to be one of the Monolith's strongholds until they were knocked out by the Clear Sky, but now the place is under the control of the sinners. .
Tell me about Radar. .
Former air defence radar station located south of Pripyat city on the very border of the Red Forest. An area controlled by the group "Monolith". A kind of conditional border of the Zone. Somewhere out here in one of the underground labs is the famous "Brain Burner". Experimental psi set-up, because of which the passage to the northern part of the Zone was closed for a long time. .
Unfortunately these are the most unexplored places in the Zone. Therefore I have only the most general information. It is also unknown how many of these laboratories exist, because perhaps it was their activity that led to the emergence of the Zone..
Crawling through any catacombs in the dark brings nothing but unpleasantness to life, although it does raise blood adrenaline levels, which is invigorating. There is little chance to get hold of any useful loot, but you can come across some rather unexpected and unfriendly creatures. There's no limit to the joy of both. Perhaps these dungeons once housed one of the X-laboratories, though there is no exact information to confirm it. .
X-18 was one of Project X's laboratories, located in Dark Valley under the building of a small repair shop. X-18 studied the most basic principles and effects of such effects. It was probably from the bowels of this laboratory that many of the known mutant species came to the Zone. It can be assumed that X-18 was one of the first O-Consciousness laboratories. The first time equipment and materials (including, apparently, the experimental animals) were supplied there from the nearby "Institute of Breeding and Genetics of cereals. .
X-16 is a laboratory located underneath the Amber factory. It houses the so-called "Brain Bulb", essentially a huge brain that creates psi radiation in the factory and the northern part of the lake. .
X-10 is the control bunker of the Brain Burner (Radar). The minus-1 level houses the on/off system for the unit.. .
There are many legends about these underground abandoned catacombs beneath Pripyat, but even more legendary stalkers have perished here. The legends say that once upon a time there was a hidden railroad from the nuclear power plant all the way to Chernobyl, or maybe even further. God only knows what was transported, where and why. Even after the first accident the undergrounds were sealed off by the authorities, and then simply covered with all sorts of rubbish. But dozens of years later the maniacs from the "Monolith" have dug out the tunnel, and followed the catacombs all the way to the power plant. Now everyone can repeat this feat of pioneers..
Spread the word about the Agroprom Land.
Spread the word about the X-18 lab.
Spread the word about lab X-16.
Spread the word about the X-10 lab.
Tell me about Pripyat-1.
Thank you, learned everything I wanted to.
always at your service...Good luck, stalker.
Well, I'm also interested in....
choose next....
From its inception, the Zone began to attract people who infiltrated and were in its territory illegally. This is how stalkerism came about. At first there were not so many of them and they were mostly loners. But with time stalkers began to form groups. At first small groups of five or ten people. Later these groups grew larger and had more definite goals and tasks. Someone managed to establish channels to sell artifacts through the perimeter, and vice versa - channels to deliver weapons and equipment. Thus stalker clans emerged in the Zone. Initially they were few in number, they had no bases, no uniforms of their own. Many small groups perished, others united, others split up. No one knows for sure which factions emerged at the outset. According to one version one of the first to emerge was the Furious clan, the Phantom, and several others. It was only a few years later that the "Duty", "Freedom" and "Monolith" appeared. Choose which clan you want to know about. .
Tell me about clans that once existed.
Uh, there were a lot of those. And many of them can't even be called serious groups. They were basically a bunch of crazy assholes who had come to the Zone just for the thrill of it. Many didn't even make it through the first few months - they were all dead. They were the Heels, the Gong, the Hammer and Sickle, the Clowns. There were exceptions, however. Very serious stalker alliances that existed almost from the very beginning of the Zone, but died for one reason or another. For example, there was a grouping of semi-mutants "Furious". By their principles and beliefs as the Duty, even cooler. The only thing is that they could not survive - mutants, though not completely. But they were almost all killed by stalkers "Insight" and "Chaos". There were also groups - "Raven", "Suicide Squad", "Jerahon", "Children of the Zone". All of them died sometime before 2010. "The Suicide Squad was a clan of escaped convicts. They were wiped out by the pre-existing "Duty" in alliance with the "Seeker". The "Hierakhon" - ordinary sectarians - disintegrated after the death of their spiritual leader. Many of the former Hierahonians later joined the ranks of sinners. "Raven - was once one of the strongest in the Zone, then controlled the entire dump and Agroprom. Wiped itself out. Some leaders wanted to seize as much territory as possible, while others wanted to explore the Zone. As a result the clan split into three independent groups. One of which later became known as "Clear Sky". The other two fought a long time and in the end were wiped out by gangsters from the "Alpha Clans" and "Renegades". That's all I know about the early stalker clans. Anything else you want to know? .
Tell me about neutral clans. .
Spread the word about hostile groupings.
Most stalker clans try to keep peaceful relations with others, at least they don't attack singles for no reason, though they may fight among themselves. These are such groups as the "Duty", "Liberty", "Clear Sky", "Dawn", "epiphany", "Seeker," "Last Day" and several others. If you wish I can tell you more about them. Choose what faction you want to know. .

"Neutrale stalkers.
Group "Enlightenment" emerged back in 2007 and was hardly one of the first stalker clans. Initially their ideology was more reminiscent of svobodovtsy. They were in constant conflict with the 'Fury' clan, until finally the latter was finally wiped out. However this confrontation has undermined the forces of the Enlightenment too, and soon, in order to avoid eventual annihilation, they have called for the disbandment of the clan. However, the clan leaders had agreed, should more favourable conditions arise, to re-establish the clan. Their next epiphany took place about four years later. However, with completely opposite goals. Most members of the new Enlightenment were military stalkers who still had ties to the official military. They set up a base in Northern Kordon under military cover, which helped the clan gain strength. In many ways similar to the 'Duty'. Nothing more is known about them. .
Little is known about it, information is contradictory. Most likely, this grouping consists of experienced stalkers. In 2011 a stalker nicknamed Ghost killed their ringleader. The new ringleader's name, according to some reports, is Ganja. They study the Zone. They believe the Zone will sooner or later expand to a threatening size and the Great Ejection will come, killing all life. They're interested in psi influence. However, some people consider this group just a stalker clan, someone - mercenaries, and someone calls them the usual drug addicts... Some say that they produce a drug called "Last Day" from mutated cannabis and artifacts, which causes a strong euphoria, which can even drive insane or zombie.
"Clear Sky" - The Explorers of the Zone, a little-known clan lost somewhere in the Swamps. Reliably no one knows what their numbers are, what they do, or what their goals are. But those rare stalkers who have come from the moors talk about guys in sky-blue camouflage. Stalkers are ecologists of a sort. They study the Zone, looking for a way to cure the world of this pestilence. They're neutral towards all factions. Their leaders were Professor Lebedev and Professor Kalancha. The founders were previously involved in O-Consciousness projects. They settled on the peaceful marshes, where they began to do research. In 2011, they had more conflicts with renegades and began to lose ground. That's when they picked up Scar, who had been weakened by the Superdischarge, and decided to enlist his help. He helped them fortify on the marshes and they made their way to the Chernobyl nuclear power plant to find the cause of the Superdischarge - the Strelka. They took an active part in the faction war, first crushing the Renegades to the ground and then knocking out the Monolith from Limansk and the Hospital. In doing so, however, they strained their forces. Contrary to Lebedev's calculations, after the cleaners broke through to the Chernobyl nuclear power plant, there was another Super Throw and almost the entire group was brainwashed by the project "S.T.A.L.K.E.R.". After that their clan ceased to exist. The fate of most of the leaders is unknown. But what is known for sure is that those Chistonebians who did not take part in the campaign to Chernobyl, left the swamps and went deep into the Zone, where they fortified themselves in the area of the "Jupiter" plant. It was there that their new leader Nazar created the Dawn clan from the remnants of Clear Sky. .
Small but fairly strong stalker grouping, formed after the demise of the "Clear Sky" clan. Their base is located near the "Jupiter" factory. Their leader Nazar, unlike the leaders of the Clear Sky, pays more attention to combat training and equipment, so the group grows and develops. It is joined by many single stalkers who do not want to wander alone in the rather dangerous areas of the Northern Zone. .
"Duty" - a paramilitary grouping, distinguished by strict discipline: its members live by the Charter in fact, only members of the "Duty" do not trade unique products of the Zone to the outside world: all artifacts found by these people are rumored to be surrendered to the scientists. Each Dolgan considers its main goal to protect the world from the effects of the Zone. Most of the group's operations involve the extermination of monsters, so the raids "Dolga" often relieve ordinary stalkers from many pressing problems. Long and fiercely hostile with the faction "Liberty". The leaders of the clan - General Voronin, Colonel Petrenko, Lieutenant Colonel Shulga. Main base is on the territory of the former plant "Rostok". .
"Freedom" (Free Stalkers) - Anarchists and daredevils who declare themselves as fighters for freedom in the Zone, and therefore constantly in conflict with the army units, military stalkers and the "Duty" faction. "Freeguys" believe that information about what is happening in the Zone cannot be hidden from humanity, thus challenging the government organizations monopoly on the ownership of local secrets and miracles. Anarchists of the Zone. They espouse the idea that the Zone is a sanctuary of unrestricted freedom for all. They believe that all laws, rules and conventions of the outside world lose force here. They fight against attempts to take control over the Zone, as well as against the 'Mercenary' clan. The main base on the Militarium. Leaders-Lukash, Loki, Smart Guy.. .
Group mainly recruited by former scientists. Small in number, dedicated to the study of secret objects in the Zone. The grouping has recently emerged in the Zone, but has already managed to prove themselves among the other groups is not the best side. They keep aloof from all other stalkers and treat them squeamishly. And their disdainful attitude towards the "code" and established norms of behaviour does not help the sympathy of the old-timers for these "pioneers". Noticed, however, that the group has little interest in the artifacts and spend in the Zone some strange research, bearing little resemblance to the actions of ordinary scientists.. .
Clan of semi-mutant stalkers, often confused with sinners. There is practically no information about them. Their outward appearance can be judged from mutilated human faces, tumors, ulcers, and hypertrophic limbs. They are very aggressive. Dark Stalkers live in the centre of the Zone. Mutants won't hurt them unless they start it themselves. The purpose of the mutant stalkers - to help some "parents" who run the zone and the monoliths, they alone promise the mutants to remake the world for them, to provide them with rights and everything they need, but for this they must fight. The ordinary Dark Ones get their assignments through other Dark Ones, with whom the "fathers" talk. Many darkies don't trust their "parents", but there's nothing left for them to do, as no one considers them human anymore. They dislike sinners, considering them defective and envious of their remaining humanity. Weapons come from the "fathers" through dark intermediaries, among them are abnormal ones. Trade is done through standard stalker accounts. They try not to fight with other Stalker clans, but sometimes there are exceptions. .
Description:Stalkers who have dedicated their time to digging in the ground. Due to their knowledge of the workings of many catacombs in the Zone, they spend almost all their time digging through rubble, leading to riches or a grisly death from an unknown wonder of the Zone. They are also known for digging up many caches of World War II weapons. They bring a lot of interesting information and loot from dungeons. Most often found on the dump and other similar places in the Zone.. .
"Neutrals" - Sometimes stalkers who do not want to join any of the existing factions, team up with friends and trusted acquaintances to form clans. The main principle of such an alliance is to stick together, lest they be exterminated one by one. Stalkers who explore the Zone alone. These are the majority, as being part of a group takes up valuable time and thus reduces one's earnings, and some simply tend to be lonely and independent by nature. When the military got cocky and started playing a double game, using the stalkers' lives as bargaining chips, the stalkers lost their temper. After the death of six comrades, which the soldiers surrendered to the bandits, Valerian united the people, attacked the roadblock and captured Major Khaletski. This small victory united the stalkers as never before. Now they have become a force to be reckoned with Mostly loners die in the Zone, you can't go it alone. But in every rule there are exceptions. .
There's nothing to tell - see it, shoot it. And all the talk. Among them, you can distinguish clans that exist along several different lines. Some are fanatics, such as the Monolith and Sin. Others are simple bandits by their ideology. With some of them the truth can be agreed, but not with all. These are such clans as the Alpha Clans, the Black Creeps, and the Renegades. There are also the official forces - these are the 'Mercenaries' and 'War Stalkers'. There are also some no less powerful closed clans, such as the "Black Angel". So who do you want to know about?. .

Monolith Group.

Mercenary Group.
Group "Bujan."
Group Alpha Psi.
Group Renegades.

bandits..
Military..
A highly established, closed military organization that originated in the Zone not too long ago. Its emergence coincided with the emergence of the Black Angel anomaly of the same name, as well as the Joker artifact that defeated it. This faction is not even more like a stalker clan, but a small mercenary army. And well-funded. All members of this group are equipped with the best weapons available today. They wear black uniform without any distinctive insignia. In combat training are no inferior to the most advanced in this respect mercenaries, and persistence and fearlessness, "Monolith. Aren't all these angels zombified? All stalkers try to avoid the Angels as soon as they see them. There is no information about their aims and purposes, nor about their leaders and base. They have been spotted a few times in Limansk and at the Abandoned Hospital. They have also been seen in Zaton not too long ago. There have been several cases of combat encounters with members of the Black Angels. One by the Dolg and one by the Mercenaries. In both cases, the winners were the Angels. .
"Sin" is one of those groups that is undoubtedly still surrounded by an unsolved mystery. All members of the group are Satanic sectarians. There are rumors that they are cannibals, which have not yet been officially confirmed. "Sin" is a deeply secretive organization and has no shortage of fighters for the reason that it has what it needs to attract new recruits. It is possible that this could be money, artifacts, favors, or anything else that might interest a man who knows exactly what he is getting into. The "Sin" clan is broken up into cells, each of which mind "its" business, without disturbing the others, but at the right moment coming to the aid of their comrades and joining with other "cells". They communicate with each other through ordinary PDAs, but they have certain codes or passwords, through which they determine the identity of interlocutors in the grouping. And the "sinners" can easily be inside any grouping of the Zone. Well, except, of course, the most active cells or those "sinners" who stalker people know by sight. Of course, they are the ones who have to hide themselves completely. They form the shock troops of the sect. And they can render invaluable assistance! "Sinners-spies" can sit at one table with other walkers, go on joint raids, drink and eat together with them and be friends, but no one will know that the other side of his soul is just waiting for the right moment to find the right moment to rob, kill or betray his friend in some way! Moreover, such friendships can last for years! For the "sinner" there are no values, because he considers himself the "orderly of the Zone" or the punisher. If you consider all the known cases of contact with the Sin, it is clear that this is the bane of loners or weakly armed and small groups of stalkers. Although there have also been cases of Sin fighters attacking small bargainers and similarly small bars. Sinners do not harm only those who can fight back. For example, no less badass monoliths, among whom there are many zombified stalkers. Having intimidated the stalkers with bloody rituals and mutilated corpses, the Sin simply pushes them into forming larger teams. And this becomes advantageous primarily to some snitches, as well as military and military intelligence. As a result we get a rather unpleasant picture: "Sin" is profitable for those who want to control the movement of stalkers in the Zone. And that could be anyone from the mercenaries to the Perimeter Security Command! And also peacekeeping forces who are interested in seeing as few stalkers as possible leaving the Zone together with its gifts and secrets! Aside from this serious cover-up, the Sinners do realise that they are an enemy of the stalker community. "Sinners" make themselves huge and rich hiding places, and are always ready to go "underground". They also make their living by exploiting such ugly phenomena as slavery and discovering dangerous areas of the Zone with "picklocks". And it doesn't matter to them whether the "lockpick" moves forward by their naivety or at gunpoint. In order to force a person into an anomaly, such people have very sophisticated means of persuasion. In addition, it is very likely that sinners have intercourse with the "Monolith" - this is indicated by many circumstantial facts. .
"Monolith" - A group that looks more like a religious sect. Its members believe that an evolutionary crystal - the Monolith - of unearthly origin lies at the centre of the Zone. Most stalkers despise adherents of the Monolith, considering them insane. Since its formation, the group prevents the advancement of stalkers to the centre of the Zone, explaining this by the latter's ill intentions towards the Monolith. Rumor has it that the Monoliths have a large base somewhere closer to the centre of the Zone, but the exact location knows no one but the members of the group. Before the complete zombification, there was a conflict with the factions of the "Duty" and "Freedom". "We won't let anyone through, any interference by you could result in the ultimate demise of the Monolith. We will open fire on anyone who comes within 30 meters. "This is what one veteran stalker says in the Stalker Bar: "Those who believe in Monolith are lunatics, they scream about it, but no one knows what's at the centre of the Zone. The invisible crystal that fell from the sky... Ha, ha. I think it blew up one of the secret labs. Someone even said they used to work there. But of course you can't bomb the Zone, not only would the radiation blow up all over the world, but the Zone's reaction could blow half of Europe apart." The Monoliths were weirdos before they went completely "off the rails. The clan had sprung up around the end of 2008 and was a small group of loonies. They all talked about aliens, the exclusivity of the Zone, the Alien experiments, and, of course, their beloved Monolith. And they were even believed, despite the fact that there were no living witnesses. Of course, there were enough talkers who said they'd seen Monolith themselves. But who would believe Sanka the Redhead, or Tattletale, who hadn't even been to the Agroprom themselves? Now the Monolith is a top-secret, militarized, state-of-the-art grouping. By far the largest grouping in the Zone. Such a dramatic change with the Monoliths occurred about two years ago, when it became known about the existence of a secret project "O-Consciousness". According to one version stalkers "Monolith" were zombified by "O-Consciousness" by means of one of the psi installations. Thus Consciousness has created a small but very powerful army for its own security. The Monoliths control all areas from Radar, Limansk and further towards Pripyat, the Tesla Zone and ChAES. Even after Strelk eliminated some of the members of the O-Consciousness and stormed the military in Chernobyl and Pripyat, the Monoliths were never destroyed. They soon recovered their positions and became even more powerful than before the assault. Nothing is known about the group's leaders. Only a few of their military and spiritual commanders are mentioned, such as Charon, killed by the Rifleman, as well as the odious Adept, Voland, Guron and the Eruption. .
"Mercenaries" - People who can complete any task for money. Know the Zone and its spawn worse than the average stalker, and often die where a green novice would have noticed the danger. But when it comes to war with people - here they are experts. The most mysterious and secretive group in the Zone, in whose existence many people do not believe. They are a professional in their field, and can quickly take out any stalker and even eliminate a small group of them. They have some of the best weapons and equipment available. Apparently they charge a lot of money and artifacts for their services. Their base used to be in the Wilderness Territory, but after the famous storming of Chernobyl the mercenaries moved it closer to Pripyat. Its location is still a mystery; apparently it is somewhere around the Jupiter plant. According to one version it was originally mercenaries who guarded closed secret laboratories in the Zone before the second explosion. It is even possible that they worked for the O-Consciousness before they were zombified by the Monoliths. Not much is known about the leaders. Rumour has it that they were once individuals with the names Volkodav, Xavier, Roland. The names Jason, Hog and Molfar are also often mentioned. .
Small group of about eighty people. Once upon a time most of 'Buyans' belonged to the 'Dol' faction, but after the leaders of the group disagreed on a temporary cooperation with their arch-rival 'Freedom', the most radical military commander of the clan Colonel Cherepanov, known as Skull, announced his withdrawal from the 'Dol'. Along with him, about a dozen or so loyal to the colonel Quads, who formed the backbone of the new grouping, left. Skull attempted to storm the Freedom base on Militar, but failed. Along with the surviving fighters he went to the Dark Valley, where he took over the farming centre, abandoned by the bandits. Now the group has grown and strengthened, though now it looks more like a bandit gang. Skull has retained only strict discipline from the Dolgan traditions. Nothing is known about possible contacts with other groups. .
"Alpha Dogs" are one of the many gangland groups. "The Alpha Dogs are distinguished by their uniforms. Their distinguishing mark is the three dog tails attached to their helmet. Their armaments and suits are donned by stalkers and military personnel. They are made up of experienced fighters. Nothing else is known about them. .
"Bandits" are the problem with the Zone. They're hated by everyone, but still respected a little bit. But the Bandits are nothing compared to the Renegades. A small group consisting solely of the most despicable personalities of the Zone. Bandits, marauders, traitors and recidivists - former members of other groups who have changed their ways and betrayed their views. This rabble has no organized structure and no leader as such. They gather in small groups and hunt for easy prey, killing and robbing, usually young and inexperienced stalkers. They are hated by all stalkers, even the Bandits, who are not too scrupulous about morality either, but even they feel that the Renegades live a "strange life". Lacking any tactics or discipline, the Renegades act in the tried-and-true "pile of small" way - running at the enemy and firing at them with all available weapons. "The Renegades were once members of other groups, but having become traitors and outcasts among "their own", they have withdrawn from society to form their own group. The Renegades also include criminals who fled to the Zone and do not want to give their share of the spoils to the bandit bosses, and who do not accept the bandit's 'rules'. "Renegades" are common on the Swamp. They decided to form a group far away from the others, so as not to have any competition and to "stand their ground". At first they even took over almost the entire territory, but, under Lebedev's leadership, Scar and the Clear Sky faction gain the upper hand. They also have well-armed and equipped units in the Redwoods. They prefer not to go any deeper. The Renegades are first dealt a devastating blow by the Clear Sky faction, assisted by Scar. After that, the Renegades have made repeated attempts to finish them off, which have (most likely) turned out to be successful in the end. At the moment, the number of the group and its location are unknown.
"Black Slugs" is a band of marauding bandits who live in the borderlands of the Zone. Members of the group - the descended to the "bottom of society" bandits. They earned their living by killing and looting tired or wounded stalkers - i.e. those who could not fight back or fight back sluggishly. Stalker groups the Black Slugs avoid. Scum of the earth, so to speak. They were mostly dressed in rags, but got their name for their cloaks, shiny and slippery. They could also wear camouflage. Occurs on the edges of the Zone - at Cordon etc., do not go deeper.. .
"Bandits" - Members of the criminal underworld, who came to the Zone for various reasons: to sell artifacts, hide from the law, buy or sell weapons. There is a lot of this element in the Zone, from lowlifes to serious criminals. Most are organized into gangs. Although there is still no unified bandit organization in the Zone, they pester the average stalker. The most favorite place, where bandits often make their raids - is the dump. During the faction wars there was one of their bases under the command of ringleader Yogi. After the latter's death the local gangs were taken over by Borov, who retreated with the main marauding force to the Dark Valley, where he set up a new base. Borov was subsequently killed by Strelok, who undermined the forces of all Dark Valley bandits. Subsequently, Lavash became the new ringleader of the bandits, who was also soon killed by a stalker nicknamed Borland. And soon the Duty conducted a massive raid into the Valley, wiping out the majority of the local bandits. After that there is no information that the latter set up any new bases in the Southern Zone. In the north, the leaders of the bandits are Sultan, Chapaev and Valet. .
Army - Soldiers of regular army units. Guard the approaches to the closed area of the Zone, patrolling the perimeter, shooting mutants, and catching marauders. Army Special Forces are elite units. They usually land in the Zone to conduct rescues and special operations. Contingent of troops stationed in the area and guarding it. Sometimes they hold expeditions into the depths of the Zone. Stalkers are shot without warning and on target, for which they earned the distaste of stalkers for military men. They also quite often take "havoc" and bribes for a pass through cordon or various checkpoints. They are armed with helicopters and APCs, but usually only use them for special missions. Also among them are military stalkers - soldiers who have received special training after their experience in the Zone, or stalkers who have signed a contract with the army. Usually equipped with large amounts of auxiliary equipment and well armed. They are mostly used to study the causes and consequences of disasters and are also involved in mapping the Zone. They can go alone or in groups of up to five. Normal stalkers are not allowed near them - they immediately open fire.. .
These critters can be found here at every turn. They started appearing right after the first outburst. One theory has it that the animals which existed within the Zone after the first catastrophe were mutated with each new release, and that's how mutants appeared. But this theory could not explain why there was a humanoid creature, because so many people in the Zone has never been. So this theory was questioned and soon was overturned. One group of free-travelers discovered in one of the secret laboratories secret materials on the experiments conducted there on people and animals. And that explained a lot. Unfortunately, I don't have much information. I can tell you about known mutant species. .
Tell me about mutant humans.
Yes, unfortunately a lot of people who die in the Zone become a kind of material, after the rebirth of which some of the most dangerous humanoid formations of the Zone are created. The most dangerous ones among them are those who have unique abilities such as telekinesis and telepathy. They are controllers and burers. Do not write off those creatures that have immense physical strength. They are bloodsuckers and snorkels.
This class is probably the most common of the critters. They are mostly found only in groups. The only exceptions are chimeras..
Tell me about animal-like mutants.
Tushkano.
Some nice ears if they weren't so toothy and voracious at the same time. They attack in a flock and try to knock them down on the ground. If you have a smart waistcoat, you can make a pole and shoot them off one by one on approaches. The method is proven, but sometimes painful. It's a lost cause to hit a moving target of such a small size and to run around on your own. You lose ammo, the armor below the knees is torn to shreds and you don't get a single bear cub in the range. .
Blind dog.
Really completely blind doggies. Who would have thought, but that's exactly the way things are. It would be interesting to find out if they were blinded by the contamination, or if their eyesight has become unnecessarily impaired under these conditions. I will not be able to get a sensible answer, but my curiosity torments me. The scientific consensus is that the dogs have gone blind themselves. That's what they write in all sorts of encyclopaedias. But the old-timers among the stalkers assert that it was the ejection flares that burned out their pupils. Regular dogs like to stare at fireworks. You don't know who to believe. But these cripples can gobble up a lot faster than their sighted relatives. They run in big packs, just like the usual city vagrants. If they get cornered, it's hard to fight back. They'll be gnawed at in one sitting. So it comes out that need to or very smart armor to get, or watch to not be pinned against the wall. .
flesh..
Every time I see them, I get sick of realising that the bloated monsters with one bulging eye and swollen other are the most common pink piglets in an ugly radioactive variation. I can't believe this is happening in the world. Ugly short legs with claw-like feet. A nightmarish sight. A painful screech instead of a piglet's squeal. It's such an obvious and blatant perversion of nature that one even feels sorry for these mutilated creatures. The only way out in this situation is to really show pity and shoot the unfortunate, sort of rabid dogs. Although it's not as easy as it may seem. The hardened pelt can withstand more than one shot from a shotgun at point-blank range. They graze in packs of several. .
Pripyat-Kaban.
Automatically useless grunts. If they run away and ram, not even thunder and lightning will induce them to turn off the planned path. The driver is asleep. The armoured train is rushing towards the doubtful future. You wait for this happy moment, retreat one step aside and plant your shotgun in the carcass, when it rushes past at full steam. In fact, if you miss it and don't get off the oncoming lane, you won't be left with a wet spot. The fangs will rip right through. In other words, the main thing is not to stall, then everything will be fine. But when they attack in a herd, you can't really turn around. It's better to turn around and drive off. You can admire the pigs from afar. .
Sleeping cats.
In appearance, not too different from regular cats. These ones are bigger, though. The fur is also strange. It's loose in shreds and covered in a putrid, greenish, liquid discharge. Maybe they do suffer from a congenital skin disease. Radiation's a thing. There's another nasty thing about them. They can break into your brain and trip the circuit breakers. Legs shaky. The hands do not obey the master. They sort of hypnotize you, make you fall asleep without asking. So you do not have much choice, you either let the cat's brains for bird food, or they eat yours. .
Pseudodogs.
Unbelievably dangerous creatures. They move almost silently, and with great speed. Can't help but raise their voices, but attack in silence. Though they sometimes whine or growl in silence. It's hard to make out. But there is no sense in trying to make it out. No matter how you look at it, they're not very chatty anyway. You may not even know what hit you and where it came from, but your head is already torn off in passing. They're a hell of a jumper. They show better results than Olympic athletes. Actually, the scariest thing is when they team up with the usual mutts. It's a dead end. You can't get away without a machine gun. That's why it's worth looking around all the time. If you spot such a monster in time, it's not too hard to coordinate a detour route. Or zahkat of the rifle long-range, so that the rope could hang brains to dry. .
Psi dogs.
Fantastic beasts. If I hadn't seen it with my own eyes, I never would have believed it. They can incomprehensibly create duplicates of themselves and set them on anyone they can find. The obsession disappears if you fire a gun of any kind. But these hallucinations bite in the most natural way. It's like a pack of mirages. It's a mess. The only consolation is that there are very few of these magicians. It's sort of a small subspecies, not a full generation. Externally, they don't differ much from ordinary pseudo-hounds. They are found only in the vicinity of strong sources of psi radiation. Plus or minus a few kilometres. The bastards are spreading out. It's probably the same psi radiation that gave them that ability to make friends out of thin air. If I had been so lucky, I would have had my own personal brothel, and a dozen bodyguards to make up. .
Chimeras.. .
Mimohod has heard talk a couple of times that this monster isn't a radiation-mutilated beast at all, but a deliberately lab-created monster. If that were the case, I would be very interested in talking to the creator of the piece. I'd give the bastard a free excursion to the nearest lair. I'd like to see a kind-hearted child and a parent see each other, cry from happiness and hug each other tightly. Family reunion. Whatever you say, it's a very bad upbringing. Throws himself at everyone. He moves very fast, and by jumping he instantly nullifies any attempts to keep his distance. They can't get out of sight, either, as they have two heads. He admires his own ass around the clock. It's a feral creature without parental supervision. Doesn't clip its nails, which is why it's not worth getting hit by. Doesn't wash regularly, and has a hardened coat of dirt. In short, it would be nice to restore the family unit, to deal with the parents have the child, and then thrown to the mercy of fate, and grew something completely ugly. It's not right. Although you can not bother to re-educate, and just shoot. .
Pseudogiants.
This is what eating wrong can do! We eat hamburgers, crunchy chips and other crap with sweeteners and flavour enhancers, then drink soda full of chemicals, and we end up with a creature that weighs two tons. If seriously, the only thing about what exactly one should not take for granted is exclusive agility of this outwardly clumsy creature. It will catch up with him in no time, gore him, and leave no wet place. Sometimes he can stomp his foot for fun, causing a local earthquake fifteen meters in diameter. The shockwave knocks him off his feet instantly. In other words, I don't want to laugh at all when I meet this fat guy. It's very hard to take him down. Brains tucked away in the depths of his bloated torso, you can forget about the control shots. Shelter is impenetrable, so either long and hard firing a powerful shotgun, but it is better with a machine gun, or tossing grenades from afar. .
Zombie..
The walking corpses are literally just like in classic horror movies with dead people. Only here there's no silliness or anything fantastic, nobody comes out of their graves in the cemetery. The most mundane truth of life. Inconsiderate stalkers get their brains scorched by powerful psi radiation, and then they gradually reach a walking stupor. Clothes and weapons fray and decay. Rotting and decaying. The most unpleasant moment is when they're really lying on the ground, motionless, showing no signs of life, and you pass by without the slightest fear. You stand looking around, wondering where to go next, but a corpse comes to life behind you and silently pounces. It is not a problem to get away, they are lazy to do exercises in the morning, but it is still not particularly pleasant to run into them. Can, after all, and nibble at random, if a bunch pile up.. .
Crack..
The poor bastard was exercising on the bar, stretching his muscles. But he miscalculated a little, and his arms reached the ground. Although now it is not a problem to scratch my back between my shoulder blades, I do not need to rub myself against a tree. It takes will, and there are positive moments everywhere. In general it is absolutely incomprehensible variation of zombified people. It is difficult to imagine circumstances in which it could be so creepy. Some say that experiments in secret laboratories were involved. But there is no one to confirm these fables, so you have to figure out where such a jolly prick came from. He sees someone and immediately rushes towards him to shake his hand. But his movement coordination is poor, so he misses all the time and slaps him to death. It is easier to shoot than to say hello.
Snork.
I've always suspected that if you don't take your gas mask off for a long time, irreparable things can happen. Take it and sign it, you're welcome to admire it now. Although, on the other hand, these beauties can work as an elephant at children's matinees, you won't even need a mask. But I don't want to laugh when meeting these unhappy creatures. It is frightening to imagine how much pain and hardship it takes to degrade them to this state. A mutilated body with protruding ribs, peeling skin, and an eerie grin of hunger on the remains of its face. The scraps of clothing and that ghastly gas mask that looked like a bald, hairless skull. A God-awful sight. They prowl around in small packs in search of food, almost crawling on the ground, sniffing out prey. Like wild animals, they will leap at you. They tear you apart with their claws and teeth. Unpleasant opponent, especially when it is difficult to get rid of the knowledge that this is a human being, not a fantastic monster. .
Poltergeist.
Frankly speaking I thought such a creature didn't exist in the world, and stalkers just scare the youngsters and fantasize monsters for that. Turns out I'd be better off listening to and memorizing those tales than reeling in the old man's experience. Relatively fragile, but extremely aggressive and nimble substance. A couple of direct hits from a shotgun are easily enough to send this inexplicable phenomenon back to a parallel dimension, or wherever these immortals came from. But at the same time, you're going to get fried by jets of red-hot air coming out of nowhere, or get thrown at, which isn't great either. In other words it's possible to fight them, but it's very difficult. .
Burer..
Unbelievably dangerous and cunning creatures. They tend to live in dark and confined environments. They sense their prey's presence long before making direct eye contact, and take full advantage of it. They creep about the catacombs in proud solitude, and then suddenly their heads begin to splitting and blood vessels burst in their eyes. However, the festivities are only just beginning! In a moment all the derelict things are flying up in the air, then falling all over you. Bruises will be all over your body. The party is in full swing. Almost by accident you come face to face with the troublemaker, a bubbly dwarf in a gloomy cape and glowing eyes. These rascals are not in a hurry to meet you, they hide in corners and run away until you corner them. But even when cornered, they lash out in strange waves, knocking you back and not allowing you to get closer to the shotgun blast, for example. You have to wriggle out and act based on the terrain. Without very heavy armor in a narrow corridor will definitely smash, but if there is a place to turn, and then you have to hustle and get closer to make a grenade flap or to unload a clip. Either way, the enemy is extremely brainy and has an annoyingly rich arsenal of tools to kill you and protect you. .
bloodsucker..
Legendary monster. However, expect nothing short of serious trouble from an encounter with this particular celebrity. It has the ability to blend into its surroundings, becoming almost completely invisible to the eye. Therefore, if in a dark and damp basement seemingly no one is, it does not mean that after a moment you will not stick at the throat of this abominable creature. On top of that, in this invisible state they're completely immune to any and all weapons, which makes it really hard to stay alive. You have to catch your moments. They can tear armor with their claws in half a second, but they have very little time to think about it. Moreover, these claws are shaped like this or are smeared with something incomprehensible, but the wounds bleed insanely badly and heal very slowly. In other words, it's best not to prowl the catacombs for no reason, as they're more likely to be found in the dark. But if you really need to crawl under the stairs, it is better to stock up on medicines and the most sophisticated armor, which even is in the wardrobe. .
Controller.
Perhaps the most legendary monster, the hero of anecdotes and many scary stories. To face and survive a monster is an occasion to rejoice at your lucky star, but it's a heroic deed to bring down such a specimen. Because no body armour can save you from this monster's ability to subdue, zombify and turn you into a slave. Mothers walk around with an entourage of subordinates, ready to tear you to pieces at their muppet master's will. But as far as I can see, the conversion process more often than not ends in death, rather than a carefree future in the master's harem. The brains burn out completely, there's nothing to subdue. The only way to save your marrow is to get drunk and pull the trigger with trembling hands until you are blue in the face. But you can also run away for good.
Unfortunately almost nothing is known about the occurrence of anomalies. Scientists have been racking their brains for years about how they arise, but unfortunately, they have not been able to come to any sure conclusion. One thing is known for sure that anomalies are man-made creations as well as mutants. But it is unknown how they were created. I will tell you more about the known ones. .
Tramplin.
Another example of the abuse of the laws of nature found here at every turn. It looks as if the pressure is bidirectional, pulling in and simultaneously pushing out. There's a kind of pulsating effect due to this perpetual opposition. When this stuff is dangling at low altitudes, a small area of ground is squeezed by a sort of invisible ball. It's especially noticeable on water. If I've got it right, that's how the outward pressure manifests itself. When the artifact hunter sucks into the zone of maximal influence, and then he is torn to shreds by the differently directed pressures. It seems to be simple. In general, if so keep straining my brains, I will soon be able to get a doctorate and exchange opinions with professors on a short notice. A bald spot will emerge from regularly scratching the back of my head. .
Funnel..
Transparent ball about a meter and a half in diameter, inside which, due to the incessant pulsation of the waves, peculiar circles converge to the centre. This is the second largest of the planet's three billion years of life, with the exception of the one that is closest to the surface of the Earth and the other that is closest to the Earth. A gruesome doom. I have never once watched a gangster take pleasure in executing unwanted people with this contagion. Blindfold and go ahead. Although to be fair, there are plenty of volunteers. If something of value is temptingly discovered in the vicinity, then they will line up to experience the gravitational twists and turns. .
Carousel..
Some degree of bloodlust is inherent in all of us. There's no getting away from it. When you get away from a brute or some human being unkind and his pursuer accidentally falls on a galloping carousel, you stop and watch as a poor creature will be thrown into the air and will spin, where the name comes from, and then tear into pieces. You can be self-deprecating that there's something hypnotic about the unwinding process, but there's a recognition lurking deep down inside that it's the presence of bloody fireworks in the final performance that makes you stop and watch. It's scary in and of itself.
Electra..
One of the deadliest anomalies. It stuns with an electric shock of such mind-boggling power that only very sophisticated body armour can protect from instant frying. But you will have to invest quite a lot of money in such overalls, therefore it is much more beneficial to look around instead of searching artifacts in your nose. All the more reason to try hard not to notice the attraction. A multitude of miniature lightning bolts are woven into a kind of tangle, constantly moving across the ground, flowing across it. It's a very impressive sight in general. Except that in the immediate vicinity it always reeks of burning vegetation, and sometimes of burnt meat. .
Frying..
Very useful in the wild. You can quickly fry your enemy and eat him up, so you don't lose calories. Bandits should be baked very thoroughly, otherwise there are too many germs in their organism, they have no time to be eradicated even with such excessive temperatures. Seriously, though, it is a very unpleasant phenomenon because it is very difficult to see even close up. Ordinary air, though red-hot, is completely transparent, as air should be. Objects are slightly distorted on a clearance, but it is not striking to the eye, therefore it is almost unreal to notice while running. You fly into the oven and before you know it you can be served. .
burning fluff.. .
Not terribly dangerous, but also extremely inconspicuous. They hang down from tree branches in a sort of cobwebby curtain and look quite natural. Nothing abnormal looks, but if you run across it, you are instantly covered with almost invisible microscopic seeds or something like that. They get stuck in every crevice and generally cover you from head to toe. A terrifying itching begins, and then burn spots appear. If the open skin comes into contact with such a drape, the wounds are quite serious. Not deadly, but nothing to rejoice. .
Kissel.. .
It looks like puddles of gurgling and bubbling acid with accompanying poisonous fumes, but the nature of this liquid anomaly clearly stems from something else. Evaporation is virtually uninterrupted and the volume of liquid does not diminish at all, as if this contagion is self-replicating. Or it feeds off its own vapours, which is unbelievable. There is also another oddity, because this stuff reacts only to living organisms, and leaves the vegetation untouched. In other words, although I have faced with chemistry, but last time it was about thirty years ago, so I can't even assert anything. Just idle speculation. One thing I know for sure, you should not go anywhere near this stuff without some decent overalls. .
teleport..
Great thing would be if the destination point was highlighted. If you could choose the destination point, it would be paradise and wellbeing for everybody. Transport problems would be solved once and for all. No more traffic jams and smog in big cities. The environment would be better. But there is no harm in dreaming only as long as the controller does not catch us off guard. So now we have to use our perishable skin to figure out where the other globular door leads, straight to an abandoned artifact warehouse, or to the centre of the anomalous field. .
Psi zone..
If I understand correctly, then in this particular case we are talking about some kind of experiment that spilled out onto our mortal earth from the basements of secret laboratories. Baldies made a mistake, and everybody else is cleaning it up. First they dig out what is not necessary, and then they cut overalls to save themselves from their own inventions. I've never understood that. But I'm not going to get my head kicked in either. My business is to stock up with vodka beforehand, just in case if I feel like climbing a clearing covered with the same psi radiation. It helps a lot. Small joys with loss of coordination, double vision, auditory and visual hallucinations do not disappear, but it saves you from the most unpleasant effect in the form of death. .
radioactive zone.
The most commonplace and, at the same time, the most unpleasant phenomenon this reserve has to offer. One cannot see, hear, smell and taste this lethal danger beforehand. You will not even feel a touch of this contagion, you will vanish some time later in terrible agony, and that's all. That's why I have to go sightseeing with a dosimeter on my belt. It is impossible to step without this annoying beeper, you will be momentarily confused in a live exhibit. The local fauna is enriched with new specimens, such as these ubiquitous blind mongrels or overcooked piglets with bulletproof crust. .
How's it going....
I'm all fucked up, but you, man, you got a real fucked-up situation here. I got a report here that a walker got whacked recently - Wallop was his name and all the facts say you did it. .
Yeah, it's no big deal, maybe I had to take the sin, maybe someone else put him down. I guess he had himself to blame for his death....
I don't give a fuck if it's his fault or not-you killed him or he himself... Pobla was my man and had been working for me lately, because he owed me a lot. Anyway, you may have killed him, so his debts are on your shoulders now, got it?
Yeah, it's not nice. So how much does he owe? I can pay, or I can just tell you to go fuck yourself. .
You're a freak, you don't get it, you're tired of living and you're blaming me. In short, I haven't heard anything. You don't have to pay me, you don't have that much anyway. Pobla owes me some business. You're gonna take care of his business now, and don't you walk away, you can't back out now, you do one job and we're even. The other options are that you take off and go to the nearest Zharka, so that my guys would have less trouble. So which option do you prefer?
All right, what do I have to do?
And this is the business talk. In short, a new stalker clan appeared in our area recently - the "Dawn". Naturally, to establish mutually beneficial relations with them - they pay, we protect - have failed. So we have to teach them a lesson. I have learned that a small group led by one of their commanders is now on the territory of a cement factory on Jupiter. I need that group to cease to exist. After you take them out, don't come to me, report everything to Gawaitz on Janova. Then he'll tell you what to do next. .
Okay. Consider me signed off.
Okay, there you go. Good luck, stalker.
I'm from Sultan, about a case.
I see, so - have you dealt with the Dawners?
Yes, a group of Dawn stalkers have been destroyed.
Okay, now you need to meet Sultan's agent on Jupiter. He will be waiting for you at the halfway station. From there you will receive instructions from him.
I'm on my way.
That's it, don't contact me about this case again.
So what are the instructions? .
You, fracker, don't make a fuss, I don't like nervous people. Now we're going to follow the route to the cement factory - specifically to the collapsed bridge, I do my business there and we move on to the second point - to the south tunnels. Your task is to escort me safely to the specified route. Otherwise the Sultan will blow your head off. Once we get to the tunnels, you'll have further instructions. I think it's time to move out.
Go ahead, I'll be right behind you, I'll cover you if you need me...
I'm off.
All right, we're here.
Fine. So, in principle, I have fulfilled my task, although you probably don't understand why the fuck you had to make such a loop. But you do not need it. .
Yes, you're right. So that's it, have I repaid my debt to Vobla?.
No, fraer, it's not all that fast. Thought it was easy. Sultan told me: If you do it right, you'll be fine. Anyway, listen to this. The roach was supposed to get the Sultan a batch of Night Star artifacts. Obviously he didn't, but if you do, you get three Night Star artifacts, take them to the Sultan in person, and then he'll assume you've honored Polecat's debt. Got it, mate?
Yes, you got it.
That's it, walk away, stalker. And don't you ever show your face to me again, I'll shoot you.
Assignment...
Did you bring the artifacts?
I haven't found it yet...
So seek, you blue-winged goblin...
Here you go, I've brought the artifacts you need.
Oh, thrasher, you're growing up before my eyes! And the dawn men killed, and helped my man, and brought artifacts. In general, keep it for work. .
Thank you.
You think next time who you want to slap, and for what.
How's business?
What can I tell you, stalker-it sucks so far. Business is profitable, but lately it's getting worse. I don't know why. Something serious has happened in the Zone. Stalkers used to take equipment and weapons more willingly, but now no one conducts any big sorties. All burrowed into holes as if waiting for something.... .
Is it really that bad?. .
Imagine this. Some say that the monoliths are preparing a major raid into the central regions of the Zone. That's why the loners are moving closer to the south - to the Cordon. That's why there aren't enough customers. And even people who weren't afraid to stay, started disappearing all of a sudden. Nobody knows what to think. Except that's just the way I'm not used to blaming the Zone. .
Can you elaborate on any specific case?.
Yes please. One of the local regulars, Myron, went missing recently. Strange how things turned out. He was on his last hike - not too far - to the Burnt Farm. Myron had been working here for a long time, running small errands. Sometimes with someone in a group, but more often alone. Remarkably, he got along well with both brothers and neutrals. He was a squirrel in a wheel and always kept his ears open. And he was honest....
Well, go on...it interests me.
Nothing further to say - he disappeared for a reason. I had one thought that he was obviously someone's butt, but alas, no proof. All I can guess for whom he could work - for the "Duty", "Freedom", and maybe even the "Monolith. It would be nice to know who exactly....
Are there any people he's been in contact with most often?
Yeah, Soroka-fucking-white-boy, at first we thought he was a normal stalker, however, it turns out that the last bitch turned out to be. Gonta gave him a death sentence in absentia and I agree with him. Except that Myron wasn't exactly like him. Almost the exact opposite. .
So where did you say he was last seen, at the Burnt Farm? I'll take a walk over there, maybe I'll get something.
Come back if you have time, if you find anything, bring it to me, and I'll figure out what to do with it.
