Got it. I'll be there soon.
begin.
I found Myron. Unfortunately he's dead.
My, very unfortunate to hear that. Is there anything else?
He was killed by the controller. Here, take it, it's his briefcase and a note. I think you'll want to take a look at it.
Certainly interesting. Here- take this for the labours. Yes, by the way, a thought did come up about what Myron might have been doing and who he really was. Still need to get a better handle on it though. .
If you learn anything, don't be lazy to let me know.
Must do.
Listen, don't you happen to be a grenade splicer?
What's with the splice, we can barely make ends meet as it is, and you with your splice. What is not enough simple grenades?
Well, maybe this small contribution to your personal fund will make you reconsider?.
Whatever you want, I'm not wasting my time.
Hah, I love doing business with a serious person, you could have started with that right away, the conversation would have gone faster. All right, I used to do that shit, you know, help the hunters out, smoke the trash out of the dens a lot, and then some. But you know how long ago this was when the war was still going on clans, so right now I'm not going to get a bundle, it is something to have with .... .
And more on this point.
I need special tools first of all without them you can't solder anything, plus it's desirable to have some special information on how to assemble these solders correctly. If you want to help me, find me some and I'll build you any solder you want. .
Okay, I agree to help you.
When you find something, bring it here, I'll pay you good money for your help, it's more profitable for me too.
Well, at least where should I look for them roughly?.
Well, talk to someone here on Janow, they might be able to tell you something.
Thank you, too. Good luck.
I found something here...
Well, let's see what you've got...
Hold the tools. They weren't really easy to dig up.
Have the folder with the info on balancing the pawned grenades. I think you'll find it useful.
I found the tools and the folder with the data you need. They were really hard to dig out.
Thank you, man. Now I can build almost any universal grenade splicer.
No results so far. I'll keep looking...
Greatly found the tools, but not enough-get the info you need and then it's in the bag.
Well done, got the schematics and info, but I still can't do anything without tools.
Good, now I have a complete set. I can get to work..
Listen, can you tell me where I can get the information and tools to make a jammed grenade here?.
Yeah, I have no idea where to get them...
Well, who else is there to talk to about it?.
You should talk to Garin, he would know for sure.
Thank you for that.
Good luck in your search.
Listen, Hawaiian said you might know where to find information and tools for making melded grenades.
Well, I can give you some tips. Tools I have, but I can not give them to you, myself need it badly. And as for the right blueprints, so you should go to the informer to Zaton. He is a master of this kind of cases, get anything you want.
Where did you get your toolkit?.
I got it from the mercenaries? that guard our camp. In general, they are not so rare tools. It's a standard army set. They're often used on modern armored vehicles or attack helicopters. But of those samples that were in the Zone - stalkers took them all out about five years ago. .
How could the mercenaries dig them up?.
Said they pulled out of the crashed helicopters recently. I think you should know better than that. Alright, I have no more time to fuss, good luck, stalker. .
Listen friend, I have a case for you. I need the information and tools to build a melted grenade.
I think I can help you with that. I'll try to get it done by tonight. I'll text you on your PDA when to come over.
Yes, I almost forgot, Garin said that such a tool might have been supplied to military vehicles. He got them from the mercenaries who managed to clean out the recently downed helicopters before I did. .
I could have guessed that without you, but thanks anyway. And by the way, it's going to cost you ten thousand, get the money ready in advance.
It's a bit pricey of course, but it can't be helped. It'll be fine, don't worry about it.
Then be in touch..
I'm about our case. Well - did you find what I asked for?
Yes. Here are the blueprints. And now for the tools: unfortunately I have no direct access to the local mercenaries, but I managed to establish that they were indeed hulling the downed military helicopters. All of the junk they managed to steal was probably somewhere at the recycling station, or at the station's facilities. Nothing more could be dug up about the tools.
Well, well, much obliged - here's your money, if anything I'll drop by...
Done.
No more help needed?.
The information you gave us on the unknown anomaly was disastrously lacking. All we have also heard about it is what some stalkers say. People who have been there, said that just a fog around and everywhere you go you always end up in the same place. .
So what should I do?.
We need you to gather new material on this anomaly. Start by asking Raccoon, he might be able to help you.
Okay. I'll report back when I know more..
Waiting..
I'll ask you next time.
Whatever you want....
Do you happen to know anything about the Space Bubble anomaly?
Rare anomaly, know little. For 20,000 I can tell you.
Here you go.
There was a loner nicknamed Lesnik. He was old, but had plenty of experience. One day he found himself in this anomaly, but he was lucky. There he found the artifact Compass. He realized that if this artifact was in that anomaly, then they were connected. The woodsman immediately started looking for a way out. It was as if the artifact was prompting him. He managed to get out using that artifact. Then there was a whole story about the artifact being stolen from him, then returned, whatever. So, I recently heard that Noah was able to dig out an artifact like this somewhere. .
But if you study the artifact, it is possible to advance in the study of the anomaly.
Well, you see, you've almost got it figured out.
I'll go have a chat with Noah then. Thank you.
You're welcome....
I don't have that amount right now.
Do you know anything about the Space Bubble anomaly? .
Naturally. And even hit it once.
And how did you get out.
Know how. There is one such artifact - the Compass. With his help he got out..
And can you tell me where I can find him?.
The last time I found a thing like this was on the South Plateau. They usually occur two, three at a time. But then I didn't have time to look for all the artefacts. I found one and left. There are a lot of mutants out there, and it's hard to get through them all. I hope that the way to the plateau you remember?
Yes, I remember.
Good luck.
Where I got the artifact Compass. It's spawned by a Spatial Anomaly. I think that if you examine it you will find the answers to your questions. .
This is just great. I will start experimenting immediately. Here - this is for your efforts.
always happy to help science.
All the best..
Hey, man, got any work for me?
Of course, there is always work to do, and one very serious matter cannot be delayed. But first things first. Recently a very big deal went wrong with our direct involvement. A lot of good people died in the process. And it was all the work of the Dolg. Whether they acted alone or were helped by someone else doesn't matter, what matters is that no matter what kind of "shaky truce" we have with the debtors here, they slap us in the face like that. I can't just let that go. And I intend to take revenge. .
How do I fit into this whole revenge thing?.
In the most direct way. You're invisible, and neutral to most stalker factions. You're the best candidate for the role of our executioner. In general, you should eliminate the Drogov, who were directly involved in the massacre of our people. Now my best bloodhound, Anubis, is gathering information on the whereabouts of the Quads we are interested in. You're working together now. He's your spotter- any questions now go to him.
Okay. I'll take the job. True, I'm not too fond of getting my hands dirty... Moral compensation should be appropriate.
I understand. 50,000 up front now and another 50,000 after the job is done, plus we'll get you some gear. Now go Anubis is waiting for you. .
No, I won't take it.
Whatever, if you change your mind, come in...
So you're the man Loki hired to be the punisher of debtors.
Yes, that's me. Let's skip all the formalities and get straight to business, shall we?.
Whatever. Anyway, the theme so far is this. In the recent massacre at the eastern tunnels on the debtors' side, two combat quads were primarily involved. A scouting quad, and a few more from extra cover. My job is to locate them, yours is to go to them and destroy them.
And the location of which quads do you now know? .
Quad of their field commander Haran- now near Janov. I think you can already go to give him my regards.
And what about the others. Do you have the information?.
Warg, the Debt infiltrator - who basically sniffed out our plans and turned us in - is unknown at this point, we'll probably have to go to Zaton for him. About Shaitan, that vile creature, who has killed most of our guys, I will find out very soon. As for the scouting quad, that's easy, you just have to wait for the right moment. Alright, what are you standing around for - go kill Haran, he deserves it.
I'll be there soon.
So, did Haran get what he deserved?.
Yes, he and his men are dead. And who else was brought here?.
This is Goose Bitch. Snitch. He ratted us out to the dolgovs. He's the one who tipped off the Debt agent about our secret base. And he also negotiated with Shaitan about attacking it.
So why haven't you shot him yet?
Gusak knows a lot. I've already questioned him on matters of interest to me, now it's your turn. Find out where Shaitan is now. Then go there and kill him.
Okay, let's see what happens.
First_talking.
Ah, you're the bitch. I recognize you, I was saying... heh...im...that you were in on it...
You can't prove anything anyway you bitch, I've always worked for Freedom unlike you, and back then you were just lucky I didn't turn you over to Anubis before you attacked their base.. .
...well yeah, that's how I believed you...that Anubis of yours, if you had any idea who he really is... ok...what do you want? .
I don't care about Anubis, but I'll make your lot easier if you tell me where to find Shaitan?
I'm going to get killed anyway... although the hell with them all....hm...hmmm... "Duty", "Freedom", may the Zone devour you all...and you along with them... And Shaitan, he's at the railway tunnel now, we should have a meeting there...that's it I don't want to talk to you...hmmm...ah...
At least now you'll die quickly...goodbye....
...damn you...
As I understand it - Shaitan is done. Nice work. I haven't been idle either,.
With Shaitan, it was a bit of a struggle. His fighters were too strong. Yeah, by the way-did you find out where to find those spies from the mask show? .
Yes, they're not far from here. Waiting for their fakers now. Found out they're doing some business with the scientists there. One of them's dressed as a scientist, by the way. But he's expendable, too. Hurry up, or they might run away.
Nothing, they won't run away from me.
I already figured that out. After you take out the Dogue saboteurs, report back to Loki. But I'm not saying goodbye to you yet....
Happy Loki, our enemies are defeated. The Quads of Shaitan, Haran and Marmedon have been destroyed.
Great news. Here you go, as I promised. The second part of your payment.
Anubis was a pleasure to work with. He knows his stuff. Where is he now, by the way?
I sent him to the Zaton. There's one other person left who hasn't been punished. It is Varg. Anubis must find him.
I think he'll do well.
I have no doubt. And you're about to go after him too, so don't relax..
Listen, do you need any help?
I need you to bring me three bloodsucker tentacles and two anabiotics that allow you to carry an ejection. The payment will be generous - immediately upon execution. .
And why, let me ask you, the doctor, would you need bloodsucker tentacles?.
Friend, listen, why are you asking unnecessary questions yes...? I pay, you work. Isn't that right now? Nobody pays for questions. So you take it or any other stalker will do the same. .
I'll take the job.
Fine, as soon as you find everything come straight to me. I'll pay either cash fifteen thousand or the new medkits of your choice. Good luck stalker.
Then go after the bloodsuckers yourself.
Whatever, if you change your mind, come in...
Here, I've brought what you asked for. Now come on about the payment.
Okay. It's your choice - either pick it up in cash or medkits.
Give me cash.
I think I'll take the medicines.
Here's your money, thanks again for your help.
Take it away, it's an army med kit. Very useful in the field..
If I look into it.
Have you got a task for me?.
It's very good of you to drop in on me now. There's a case you can't refuse.
Really? So what am I supposed to do with it? Exactly how much?
A lot, my friend, a lot. Here's the deal: we've recently received a very serious order from some seriously rich people from the big earth. They wanted a rare and urgent artifact, the Violin. Immediately they offered a double price, and I found it necessary to agree. .
Fine, and I take it you're suggesting I'm the one doing the searching? Wouldn't one of the ordinary stalkers do it better?
Mayor, you're right on point. Don't get too excited, twenty-five percent of the deal. That's about fifty thousand, no less. How - a convincing argument, to crawl on his belly with a detector between anomalies? .
Weighty, but can you at least give me a clue as to where this artifact can be found?
Eh, that's up to you, my friend. The violin, if memory serves me correctly, has only been found a couple of times. So talk to Ozersky about it. He's an expert on artefacts among scientists. He might be able to tell us something.
A nice perspective. Okay, if I find something, I'll be sure to let you know....
Do you know anything about the artifact Skripka?
Of course. This is a very rare and expensive artefact. In appearance, it is a large glowing orb. During all time only five samples of this artifact were found. However, we are not interested in such things. .
And tell us why scientists are not particularly interested in this artefact.
The point is that the violin has purely aesthetic value - the artefact hangs half a metre above any surface and shimmers brightly in all the colours of the rainbow. In addition, the slightest breeze produces a melodious ringing in different tones. It is not radioactive, but it does not have any other useful properties. That is why mainly collectors with a lot of money are interested in it. As the value of the violin is estimated at around half a million.. .
And can you tell me where I can track her down?
I can say for sure that the maternal anomaly in the violin is called Echo. But this anomaly is even rarer than the artifact itself. However, the violin can sometimes be found near psi zones. Though, I think some experienced stalker can tell you about it in more detail. Beard on Skadovsk, for example. Well, he certainly specializes in artifacts, and even if I remember correctly, he once found a similar thing. .
Thank you very much.
Good luck.
Listen Beard, here's the thing, can you tell me where I can find the artifact Skripka in the area?
Huh. What do you need it for, if it's not a secret?.
It's just an order and I have to complete it.
Okay, you don't want to talk, don't do it. Fiddler's only been caught once on Zaton. That was back when I wasn't behind a bar, but out exploring the Zone. I managed to find it near the Scab anomaly, where the psi field is crazy-you know that. So I'd encourage you to look in places where there's a lot of psi activity. Speaking of which, don't write off the Brainiac anomaly either. I think you'll have to go there as well.
Thank you, friend-helpful..
You're welcome. Just don't forget - you need a good detector to find it.
There, I got the artifact Skripka. It wasn't easy to do. So, I'm counting on a good reward.
Fairly, here's your share. I can see that you have something to say.
Yes, Loki. When I was climbing through the anomalies with the detector for your artifact, I was attacked by two mercenaries in libertarian uniforms. Anything you want to tell me about that?
What's the story here - I had to check something, and then this order for a lot of money. You know yourself, that now snitches like pseudo-snitches. I'm just spreading the word to the general public. Anubis, by the way, your buddy had this case under his control. So, don't mind me, but we found another snitch with your help.
So, was that you using me as bait? You're such a bitch, Loki, I didn't expect that from you. I don't know what the hell I'm gonna do with you now.
And you, green chink, watch your mouth, and don't say a word. Otherwise you'll have to regret it....
Fuck you...
Are you Degtyarev?
You could say me, why?
I know you've just been to the Dugout, and may have dealt with a stalker named Volba.
Hmmm, where did you get that information?
his source reported.
What do you want?
So either you help me or I tell the Sultan- that you go behind his back and try to pull off all sorts of schemes involving his subordinates.
Hey, who the hell are you, another gangster....
Shut your mouth on...I trained Strelok himself when I was a prospector at the Rookie Camp at Cordon. I hope you've heard about who Strelok became. .
Why did you become a bandit?
None of your business, you little shit. So, in short, your decision - either you help me, or you're done for.
Well, okay, I'm pretty much ready to help, what do you need to do?
In short, a small group of stalkers came to Zaton. Their leader, nicknamed Phantom, was my deputy on Cordon. That's the problem. They haven't reached Skadovsk yet, and they're not supposed to. I don't need Phantom blabbing about my past here. .
I see, you want me to take him down?
Do you guess, though. Kill the Phantom and you'll be happy. By the way, I heard that he carries some valuable information from the south of the Zone. You can have it for yourself and give it to the informer, it will go to you as a payment for your work. For me it is important that the Phantom is gone forever.
I'll do it, don't worry.
And I'm not worried, because it's in your best interest first...
I'm about Wolf's errand. Here you go-it's the Phantom stalker's PDA. Wolf said to give it to you.
Yeah, I'm already aware of that. I think Phantom had some valuable information stored, since he encrypted all the contents. As soon as I crack the code, I'll let you know.
By the way, did you know that Wolf used to be a freelance stalker at Cordon, that he was in good standing there. So why did he join the bandits? .
Zone bro, it's probably all about it. All I know is that after Strelok once knocked out the second Incinerator Wolf was somewhere on the Militarium. The Phantom took his place at the rookie camp. What might have happened next - only the black stalker knows. .
But you can still try to get him back. I mean, he's not a complete scumbag.
I'm not sure, my friend. As soon as he got here I felt the man was a killer. With a capital A. It's hard to explain to you, but believe me, I know what I'm talking about. Wolf won't put up with his past. And what you've done for him is proof of that. If you want to, you can try talking to him. He and his gang are on the dredge. .
I will go there now. But if I can't talk some sense into him, I'd better kill him before he does something bad here.
I agree with you on this one, if he doesn't want to listen to you, shoot the bastard. No one will mind, that's for sure. I agree with you.
Eh, Diagterev, why the fuck did you come here? I didn't tell you to come to me after the deal was done!
Wolf, listen. Yes, I did your errand- Phantom is dead, but you died with him too. How can you live like this. Be a scum, a bastard, you were different...
Are you trying to cure me? And I was thinking, I will not rat on you Sultan, the main thing that he killed Phantom, but no, I see that I was right, I put him in you. All, you had enough of it, now you do not live because of Frozen. .
Well then bitch, consider yourself a death sentence...
So, what are the instructions now?
You will need to go to Zaton and wait for Anubis there.
And how long should I expect it there? I'm kind of pressed for time too.
I don't think it will take him long to track down Varg. Once he finds him, that's how he'll contact you. I think it's more likely he'll get in touch at night. .
All right, I'm off.
When you're done there, don't come back to me, Anubis will deal with you himself.
Ah, stalker - told you we're not saying goodbye. See, I was right.
Yeah, I agree with you. But let's talk business first, shall we? Did you track down Varg?
Are you having doubts? Eh Major, don't underestimate the capabilities of others so much. You're not the only ones who work for the SBU.
I'm not underestimating anyone, rather the opposite. So, where do you want to go?
Varg is now north of here, just past the Cauldron anomaly. Take this package is addressed to him. He's already waiting for you.
I don't get it, so I don't have to kill him? What the hell kind of package? How do you have such a direct line to him, aren't you the enemy? .
Too many questions Major, just do as I ask now and we'll both be happy. You don't have to kill him. You hand over the package and say it's from Anubis and come to me. I'll explain everything later. All go. .
You know.
Mayor, great, I sense you're coming my way.
And good luck to you Varg. How are you?
Labouring quietly, the bosses sent here - to these swamps. I haven't had a day's rest since that story, can you imagine? Yes, for such cases they should give medals and leaves, though just kidding - what kind of leave have stalkers here, even the dolgovtsy.. .
Why your superiors are being so hard on you. That's not good.
Dismiss this Anubis, my divorcee. Today one thing, tomorrow another. I'm here now, waiting for you with a load. Do you have it?
Yes, I have... so wait, you have the breeding Anubis?...so it's....
What? Is something wrong? Anubis is one of our main counter-guards and my immediate superior. A lot of the credit for the successful completion of that freedman's base went to him. And I see he's already working with you. You're bringing me the materials I need for the new diversion, aren't you?
Yes, it works. Varg, listen - here's the package, I'm going to go. There's something else I need to sort out....
Good luck Major! Tell Anubis I'll do as we agreed...
First_talking.
Back. I see you're eager to find out what this is all about?.
Yeah, I'm getting impatient to put a bullet in your forehead first and then figure out what it all means? How about this? .
All right. Go ahead and shoot. After that, even if you manage to get out of "Skadovsk" alive, which I highly doubt, you will be so hunted - half of the Zone will be after you. And "The Debt" and "Freedom" and a few others. Not enough for you "Alpha" you'll also get "Beta" until you die...
You know about the Alpha too? So what are you - a longshoreman, a freedom fighter? Or who? I remember Gusak warned me and I guess he was right. And after that you killed him. What about Varg? Why did you eliminate him, was it not easier to just shoot him? .
You don't need to know who I am yet. And you're right about Varg. Exactly eliminated, and he knew who did it before he died. He did his part and he knew something he wasn't supposed to. I don't need him now. And you survived, consider yourself lucky. Lucky so far...
So you set up this whole mess. Decided to pit the clans, but why? Redistribution of spheres of influence, but that's who are you clearing the ground for - not yourself? And me, so you eliminate me when I work it off?
All in good time, Major-don't make a fuss. Explore your helicopters, make your way to Pripyat, look for the information you need. We don't need you yet. And don't try to talk to anyone about me. Not to Loki, not to Shulga, or I'll rethink my plans for you. You'll figure it out later. And our meeting will be inevitable...goodbye...
Farewell...Anubis...
For me no information has been received?.
Yes, there was one message coming in. And it was sent from an SBU agent just like you.
I wonder how he has an outlet for you?
So who's the informant in the Zone, you or me? Don't worry, he paid me handsomely to keep it quiet. And besides, I'm not the first day here in the Zone, and dealt not only with the SBU, but with someone much more serious. .
Okay, I just... So what did the agent pass me?
That's okay. Said he'd talk to you face to face. He'll be waiting for you tonight. Didn't say where, said he'd get in touch soon and let you know.
And that's it?.
No, he passed on the password: "You to me, I to you." Feedback: "Homer, the Iliad."
Fucking hell, you couldn't think of anything more original!
Who's going to figure you spies out, you're not so coded yourself, are you? Okay, good luck.
You tell me, I'll tell you.
Homer, the Iliad.
All right. Formalities are met, let's get down to business.
And it wasn't scary, it was almost up to Skadovsk itself. Wouldn't it be easier to meet somewhere on the outskirts? .
So it's not easier.
Well, what other instructions could there be, don't I have an assignment?
Command's plans for you have been slightly revised. Twenty-four hours ago, very interesting, hitherto unknown information was received at headquarters. And it has been decided to verify them through you.
What information, if not a secret?.
Some details have become known about who caused the second explosion and created the new Exclusion Zone. Apparently it was the result of an experiment being conducted here in the Zone. And it's not connected with any aliens, it's all people's fault. .
It's interesting to hear that, so what do you think it could have been?
Commanders learned that for nearly twenty years immediately after the first disaster, a number of secret defense laboratories had sprung up around Chernobyl, undertaking a variety of developments.
And whose labs were these?
Before the collapse of the Union it was ours, but then in the nineties the funding came from abroad. We do not know who was involved in this. All we know is that some of these laboratories were engaged in various kinds of research in the field of genetics, including research on humans. Others were developing new kinds of weapons based on new physical principles. However, their main project was to conduct experiments on the noosphere of the Earth. And it is the opinion of higher authorities that it was the failure or otherwise of an experiment on the noosphere that caused the emergence of the Zone. .
What exactly would my task be?.
After the second explosion, some of the laboratories ceased to function, but work continued in others. The report mentioned something about the O-Consciousness project and its impact on the Zone. The command set out to find out what the O-Consciousness project really is. .
What kind of information do you want?.
First of all, we need to collect detailed information on all the laboratories that existed in the Zone. This will allow our analysts to determine what role Project O-Consciousness played in all of this. You will receive further instructions later, after you have gathered all the information about the secret labs under the index "X".
How many of these labs are there in total?.
I don't know exactly. Supposedly about ten, but you don't have to track down every one of them and get in there. You'll just have to get some information or papers about the X-lab. I suggest you talk to the informant first, perhaps he already knows something about this.
Okay, I get it.
By the way, when you gather all the information let the informer know - then he will tell you what to do. Good luck Major.
Same to you.
I need to ask you something.
Yes, so what?
Do you know anything about the O-Consciousness project?
That's what you're talking about straight away. To be honest no one knows anything about it. And it's not even a project, but something more. Perhaps the main mystery of the Zone. But rumor has it that it's just a bunch of shifty scientists who worked at Chernobyl and were destroyed by a gunman during his second trip to the Zone. But to be honest, I don't really believe it. .
Why is that?
No one knows if they even existed. Eh, I wish I could get my memory back, they probably came up before two years ago, maybe I'd know more. And Shooter, after he's gone into the abyss. There's no confirmation. The only clue is about the X-labs, but there's not much of that either. And I take it you're going to have to look into it?
Yes, you're right. And what do you know about the X-labs?.
Well, there's something. A total of ten complexes marked with the index X are known for sure. Это Х1,Х2,Х6,Х7,Х8,Х9,Х10,Х12,Х16,Х18. I have even been to some of them, some of them are even located nearby. And I've got some information about the X9 lab. Here - I think they will be useful to you.
Thank you, I think we'll get back to you and I'll do the rest of the research.
Good luck to you, Major.
Do you know anything about the downed helicopters?
I know a thing or two. But quid pro quo. According to unverified information in the Zone, in the area of Jupiter there is a new stalker grouping "Dawn". I need to know everything about it. Maybe you have already found them? .
Not yet. But I will.
Search then come to me....
OK....
Yes, the base is near Janov.
Good, everyone should take a closer look at this new clan - new factions don't just appear in the Zone. .
They're former cleaners. Do you know anything about such a clan? Yeah, by the way, tell me about yourself. Where are you from? .
That's what it's like - cheetonebobbers... What's there to tell about me... You hurt my feelings.
what is it?.
Yes by the fact that I have nothing to answer you. I have no name, no past, nothing. Just the Zone.
What happened?. .
Two years ago, sometime shortly before Shooter made his second trek to Chernobyl, I lost my memory. When I woke up, I was in the base of the stalker clan "Liberty" - it's on the Militarium. A clever deputy of the clan leader, Svoboda, said that they found me immediately after the ejection, not far from the barrier. I had nothing on me, no weapons, no PDA, and no gear. None of them knew whether I was caught in the ejection or whether I had been dragged and dumped near the Freedom checkpoint. The only thing I managed to find a strange tattoo on my arm "S.T.A.L.K.E.R.", but what it could mean no one knew. The fact is that I survived, but I remember absolutely nothing about my past life. .
Yeah, it's sad, but how could you become an Informant - after all, you had to know the Zone like the back of your hand to do so. I think so. .
A week or so after I came to my senses Smarty decided to check how much of my old reflexes might still be in me. If I was a stalker, at the very least I should have known about weapons. When I was given a simple Kalashnikov, I could easily assemble and disassemble it with my eyes closed, and I knew almost everything about its combat parameters. The knowledge just sort of popped out of my head. It was the same with the other weapons. Then I was allowed to use a few magazines as a drill. I showed the kind of shooting that no freedom fighter had ever done before. After another week, Umnik included me in his expedition to Limansk. When we left the base in the vastness of the Zone, I could easily identify any anomaly that we came across on the way. Then Smartypants informed me that I had enlisted in the ranks of Freedom. But I didn't want that. During the expedition in the city we were attacked by a large monolithic force. We managed to fight back and it was largely due to my actions. There were only three survivors: myself, Umnik and his clanmate, Loki. I told them I had to leave, and they grudgingly let me do so. After that, I wandered the Zone for another year, recovering scraps of memory, looking for new information, and so on. Eventually I became an Informant and came here to Zaton. But to this day I could not find even the slightest shred of information about who I am. .
I'd really like to help you with this quest, but I don't think it would be easy. But it makes sense to try.
If you can do any digging, I'll be incredibly happy.
Hello Coolibin, I have a quick question for you.
Come on, ask! Anything I can do to help.
I know that you used to be a member of the Clear Sky clan, and I also happen to know a guy named Scar who once helped your faction. Could you tell me about him?
What are you all up to with this "Clear Sky", and if I wore a monolithic suit, you'd think I was an ex-fanatic. I'll have to do it next time. .
So you tell me about Scar.
What to tell about him. He was a mercenary. He appeared not long before Shram went to ChAES for the first time. Scar was contracted to lead a group of scientists to our base. But he got caught in a spontaneous ejection and didn't lead anyone to it. No one knew how he survived, not even Lebedev. After that, he offered Scar a new contract. The first: to help the group rebound from the marauder clan "Renegades", and secondly, to find and destroy the shooter, lest he did what else he did. .
And how do you think he could have survived that famous blowout that destroyed your faction at Chernobyl?
You never know. He was a tough son of a bitch, but as for luck, I don't know. I heard on the radio the last conversation with Lebedev and others - such an asshole was going on there. Even if Scar was not killed by the ejection, the monoliths infesting Chernobyl probably shot him. .
But the Shooter survived, why couldn't Shram?
Listen, go to Chernobyl and ask those who dwell there: whether there was a dude named Scar who came to your place two years ago with the Clean Sky stormtroopers just to shoot ducks - you haven't seen him, have you? You realize you're talking nonsense and distracting from your work. .
All right, don't get too boisterous. Thanks for that. One last question-you said I wasn't the only one who asked you about Clear Skies? .
Yeah, that freedom fighter came here the other day - I think his name is Anubis. He was asking about the same thing, only he didn't mention Scar. He was more concerned about Lebedev. Well, I told him what I knew in general. .
Damn, Anubis. Why on earth would he want Lebedev? He didn't ask anything else?
Listen, don't you think I have anything else to do? Are you trying to piss me off today? Get out of here before I call security!
I have a thing for you.
I'm listening to you carefully.
Do you know anything about a mercenary named Scar?
Shram, Shram something comes to mind. So this one's from The Last Day, and I remember! There was such a man. Back in the days when I was Clear Sky. .
something more you can say?.
Yeah, well, he came to us from the side of Agroprom. He was blown away by the ejection, I remember I was helping him with a new PDA to deal with. That was a hell of a blow too. But he was a hell of a shooter, though. Took all the renegades out of the swamps. And then he went after the shooter to Chernobyl, and perished, along with Lebedev and others. .
Is he really gone? What if he survived? Have you met anyone you know who looks like him?
Yeah, I think our Informer looks a bit like him, I'm just not sure. Trying to talk to him on this subject - so he almost threw me off the ship for hime. Crazy as hell, I'm with him and so it's not much of a deal..
I have one lead on this. Found a couple of curious documents in Pripyat recently. I think Shrum is our informant. .
If so, he's better off. Not that he would like that, though.. .
I don't really care. As long as I work off my contract. .
And me neither.
How's Scar doing?
Doing fine, except wait, what did you call me?
Shram.
So you managed to dig up my past after all. Wait, Scar, am I really Scar?
Yes. You're the one who once got involved with the Clear Skies faction. Then tried to kill Strelok, participated in the faction war and did a lot of other things. You have managed to be identified by Winky and Garin - the only survivors of the Clear Sky representatives with whom you once dealt.. .
Proofs, facts?. .
Please- here's a secret instruction for one of the former monolith leaders to Haron. It was compiled by one of the O-Consciousness leaders, Grechet. It says that you and Shooter were thrown back into the Zone after being processed. Apparently you became S.T.A.L.K.E.R. project test subjects. Except that Shooter was programmed to kill himself, and he went and interrupted the "O-Consciousness". So what was done to you then, because in the two years since you were dropped from the death truck on the Militar, nothing else unusual has happened to you. .
I don't know that. And I don't want to know. I'll just live and that's it. Even with this, but you can live. Here, take this for the effort.
Okay Shram, if I need anything from you, I'll let you know.
Bye, major.
Recently heard that scientists in the Zone have learned to create experimental grenades based on certain artifacts. Is it true?. .
In general, yes. And I'll say more: I can make such grenades. True, only prototypes for now.. .
What would it take for you to start producing them for general consumption?.
Well, I don't know, although I do have one unresolved case, and if you help me with it, I'll take care of those grenades. .
What's the deal?.
Briefly, there is such an artifact - "Eye", maybe heard about it, but if not, I tell you. Extraordinarily rare and expensive. I am interested in it exclusively due to its wonderful feature - to record events happening around itself. It's like a natural video camera. I would like to learn more about it.
Okay, well at least where can I get one?
You'd better ask Garik about that, friend - he's our resident artifact finder. But one thing I can tell you that here in the vicinity you will not find it, so be prepared to go to Pripyat.
Why don't you send Garik himself there for him then?
You see, the city is very turbulent right now and Garik is unlikely to go anywhere but the Laundromat, where the military have fortified themselves. I can tell that Garik once dragged such an artifact from Pripyat, after that he spent a week coming out, saying, he's suffered so much, that no money will go to Pripyat for the artifacts no more.
Okay, I'll try to help you.
Excuse me, lots of other stuff to do.
That's great.
Stop by if you need to.
Can you tell me about a case?.
Yes, of course. Whatever I can do to help.
Garin needs the Eye artifact desperately, and he said you once found something like it in Pripyat. Can't you tell me about it? .
Yeah, I remember that time. Barely got out of that asshole alive. The monoliths were chasing me all over town. Never went to Pripyat for artifacts again. I'll just drive people back and forth. And the Oak is a very rare artifact indeed. I found it somewhere near a school or a kindergarten, I don't remember exactly. Then such a palm began that I do not soorientatsii. .
And what is the artifact itself?.
Yeah, I don't think you'll mistake him for anything. A blue-green ball with a dark cloudy centre. If you look into it, you can see a lot of interesting things. But remember, Oko is a rare thing, and if you find one, you're out of luck, because it might be months before another eye miracle appears. At least, I know that besides me this artifact was found only ten times, and only in Pripyat. The last time Prigorshnya dug out in a cinema, but there now the Monolith support base and it is unlikely they will leave lying around such a junk just like that, should it appear there again. So it's better to look where I said. .
OK, thanks for the tip.
Good luck in your quest. And don't forget to bring a better detector. Not everyone can detect an artifact like this.
Happy, Kulibin, I've got your Eye.
Dreamy, give it here. I was beginning to think you'd never find such a thing.
I've gotten artifacts like this before. So, will you take the grenades now?
Definitely. By the way, this is for your hard work. Fee though modest, I'm not a dealer to make a lot of money, the more so I need an artifact personally..
So when can you start making grenades?
You can do it right now, but you'll need to bring me some components to make them.
Hello Beard, do you have any special work for me?
Why wouldn't she find a job? There's always a job. And now you didn't ask for nothing. Anyway, I have a very serious contract here.
I'm all ears.
This is the thing, Major-some very big scientists from the big earth are now interested in a few "very small" but insanely expensive artefacts. Why they want them, I do not know, but the scientists offer a lot.
And what artifacts, if it's not a secret?.
What a secret now. The artifacts are called "Walnut" and "Drill". I don't think you've ever encountered them, so those names don't really mean anything to you. .
What does it take to make them talk?.
And what you need is this. As you have already realized I can not tell you exactly where to look for them, because in my life I have not found anything like that. But I know someone who has.
Come on, tell me more.
So there's this stalker, Lemur is his name. Earlier, back when I myself was a stalker, this Lemur was just a vagabond from Southern Cordon - nowhere beyond the Salvka never looked, nothing more serious than the Stone Flower did not find, guns cooler than a "Kalash" in his hands. However, about a year ago he was very lucky to meet a geologist. Then the two of them set off on a dangerous trip through half the Zone. But I do not know how it ended, I know for a fact that Lemur was no longer a green loser and shuffled off into the depths of the Zone. They say that he found one of the artifacts of interest to us - Nut. And then, as I was told - Lemur was known to one now no less legendary stalker named Enoch - he told Lemur about the artifact Drill. I do not know whether he found Drill after that, but the main thing is that the stalker knows about both artifacts.
Okay, so where am I supposed to find this Lemur?
You don't have to look for anyone anymore. He came to Janow the day before yesterday to rest and replenish supplies. I got a message from Hawaiian just yesterday. He says that Lemur has told him that he wants to join any grouping, but in the last go almost died for nothing - like, he was too shy to continue to walk alone. So, go to Janov and talk to Lemur there. After that, look for artifacts and don't come back without them. I'll pay you ten percent of the total.
OK, I'm on my way.
That's great.
Maybe I'll get to it later.
As you know.
Salaam Aleikum, brother.
Same to you, Lemur. By the way, I've come to you on a case. From Beard.
How's that bearded bartender doing over there? Still sitting on "Skadovsk"? .
Yeah, where will he go from there. Anyway, I need your help. The beard has ordered me to find two rare artifacts, the Nut and the Drill. And he said you might know where to find them. .
Anyways, I can only give a rough tip. As for Peanut, I once found him by accident on the Militar, while crawling on the belly over the radioactive hills so as not to run into monoliths. Here, however, I'm not sure that the artifact can appear at all, although there is an opinion that it is more likely to occur in places with elevated radiation backgrounds. Therefore it is more likely to look in Kopacz, where there is always a lot of radiation. As for the Drill, Enoch told me that an acquaintance of his, Corkscrew, had found such an artifact. But now Corkscrew is dead and would hardly tell me how he could be so lucky. Enoch says only that Stopor hid his stuff in the overpass Pripyat-1. When he and Inok there came mutants attacked them, Stopor ditched a partner, but managed to grab the artifacts. However, he didn't get far and perished with his loot. Where is unknown, but I know for a fact that he did not get out of the overpass. And after about half a year one of the freedom fighters, Ares, it seems, pulled out one such artifact. No one's found the other one yet. Most likely it is still there somewhere.
Thank you very much, I think we need to comb through the places you mentioned. Yeah, by the way you're from the south now, what's the news there?
I came from the Redwoods, passing through Limansk on the way. Yes, it's hotter there than ever. It's almost impossible to get through the town: there's damn sinners everywhere, and where do these fanatics come from? The monoliths are too many to handle, and then there's the freaks. And what they're doing there in Limansk, these lunatics have never wandered beyond the Agroprom. And in the Red Forest is something completely crap going on - all the mutants burrowed into the holes, before there was no room for them, but now is the cleanest place in the area. However, anomalous fields have grown, maybe the Zone wants to close the sector again for conservation - maybe it's for the best. Oh yes, I forgot - the forester, by the way, also left his tower. They say that the southern graves went, but why do not know. .
Thank you anyway, valuable information never hurts...
Good luck, stalker.
What Beard, splurge - I've brought you your artifacts.
Fine Major. I knew you could be trusted to do this.
So how much do I get for my hard work?
This is a hundred thousand. Here you go, cash as always.
It's a pleasure doing business with you, is there anything else you need to get?.
No, no special orders have come in yet. When there are, I'll let you know.
Professor, I wanted to ask you about a unique lifeform detector. .
Yes, of course, ask. What are you interested?
Can a similar device be built in your lab?.
Well, in general we already have similar developments. But only at early stages. There is a prototype device capable of detecting only warm-blooded human organisms.
No, that one doesn't suit me. I wanted the device to be versatile, able to detect mutants as well. Moreover, we need him to distinguish them..
Hmm, the mutated life forms are of course very different, but in order to isolate these differences both in the spectral range and in the various frequency ranges by a recognisable device would require a lot of experimentation and a number of measurements. In addition, I think it would be even better to combine the capabilities of bioradar with a standard anomaly detector. .
You mean to say that it is theoretically possible to create a universal scanner of both biological life forms and physical anomalous zones?
Yes, I'm sure we can make it happen. Only we will need a lot of research material for all the tweaks.
I am willing to help you as much as I can.
Okay, then you'll need to collect some biological material first. We need you to bring some mutant body parts. .
Which mutants and how many?
Dog tails and boar hooves are always in abundance. We will only need samples from those mutants that are either less common or also those that stalkers prefer to stay away from. So you should bring us ten snork feet, five bloodsucker tentacles, three burer arms, and one controller arm each, one chimera claw, and one psedogiant eye. .
Wow, but wow are your queries! Why so many?
As you wanted. You think it's that easy to build a usable prototype? Expendable is expendable. And who needs bioradar you or me?
Okay, I'll get everything I need.
Also, you can bring me materials as soon as you have the required number of units of each type. There is no need to collect and then hand everything in at once. .
Materials...
So, what have you got there?
I haven't collected anything yet...
I brought ten stop snorks.
I got five bloodsucker tentacles.
I got the three arms of the Burer.
This is the controller's hand.
Hold the chimera claw.
Get the eye of the pseudogiant.
Fine, but need to get the rest of the pieces.
Okay, I'll look into it again.
I brought everything you asked for.
That's already a big plus, but not the last of what you'll have to get before we can finalise the prototype.
What else do I need to do? .
Speak to Professor Ozersky, the next stage of the prototype setup will be done by him.
Science is my homage.
Ah, stalker - good of you to come. Herman tells me you're helping us build a universal detector with a life form detection function. Well, I'll be fine-tuning this device in the second phase of development. .
And what exactly will you be refining?.
I will be performing the device setup necessary to search for artefacts correctly. Therefore, I will need some consumables. Don't worry, there won't be as many as for Herman - a few artifacts of each type of anomaly being born. Four types in total-chemical, electrostatic, thermal and gravitational. .
Which artifacts you need, tell me exactly.
I'll need three artifacts Scrap Meat, two Bengal Fires, two Twists and one Eye. Once you find the required number of artifacts of the same species you can bring. .
I think we should already start looking.
Whatever you're comfortable with..
About the artefacts...
Yes, I'm listening.
I brought three artifacts of Scrap Meat.
I got two Bengal flames.
Here's a couple of twists.
Grab it, I've got the Eye artifact.
Okay, I'll wait for you to collect the rest of the artifacts.
Wait Professor, I'll be right there.
All, I've delivered all the artifacts you ordered.
Fine, now I'll be able to fine tune the prototype based on the materials I have.
What other work will you need to do?
In the second phase, my work will consist only of this. I will try to complete it as soon as possible. The final fine-tuning of the prototype will be done by our technician Garin, talk to him about it.
Hasn't brought anything yet...
Friend, I'm from Ozersky. He said you'll be the one to finish the biodetector prototype.
Debugging is a strong word, I will only check its general functionality from a technical point of view and adjust its functionality as an anomalous zone detector. .
And what can I do to help?
Help, you say. You'll have to run through some anomalies, so I advise you to change your costume for a proper one. Sorry about that, but I can fit one in for you, it's a bit ragged and the blood isn't completely clean. Herman wrote it off, not taken from a corpse, do not worry. .
You're a shabby joker, but come on, so what exactly do I have to do?
It's simple. About a week ago, our freelance workers, led by Topol, set up special scanners at some significant anomalies on Zaton. Now, I need you to run through them and collect those scanners along with the recorded information. This data will help me a lot in fine-tuning the prototype device in the final phase. .
All right, I'm off to the Zaton immediately.
I'll be waiting, but don't get lost in the anomalies or I'll have to sell your biodetector to someone else later.
All, I've collected all the scanners.
Good, now I can set up your radar, so just wait a bit. Just some info from the readings.....A, thought so....Hmmm, maybe.... No - no change. .
What? Is something wrong? Why don't you do some more digging, and I'll mind my own business and come back later?
No, I'm done, it's just that the data you brought fully confirmed the one we already had. Consider that you ran for nothing. Whatever. Well, there you go - it's for your efforts, and I also give you your long-awaited bioradar.
Finally. All the effort I put in for him.
You're welcome to use it..
How are you doing hunter? Need any help?.
It's very good that you came Major, we have a very serious problem here. And I think you can help us to solve it.
If I'm interested, I'll do my best.
So here's what happened the other day: I got an alarming message from a stalker, saying that he recently came across a group of strange mutants, they look like ordinary blind dogs, only much more dangerous and stronger. I do not know what kind of dogs there, but one of our hunters, his name is Zubr, does not agree with me. But one of our hunters, his name is Zubr, he disagreed with me. He said, we should check him - maybe the guy is not lying, then we may miss new subspecies of mutants, what the fuck hunters we are then..
What happened next?
Yes, Zubr was probably right and there really was something serious going on there. He had checked in with me a few hours ago and threw me the approximate coordinates of their lair. Then I heard gunfire on the radio and the connection went dead. But Bison's PDA is still active, so it doesn't look like he's dead. I want you to go to the area Zubr and destroy all the mutants that you find there, and I am also interested in the fate of the hunter.
Okay, I'll do it properly, just why don't you want to catch at least one specimen of this creature?.
There's no time for that yet. There's more important things to worry about than mutants--something big might happen here soon, maybe having to defend Skadovsk against mercenaries. .
I've dealt with those mutants and found Bison, unfortunately he's dead - here's his PDA.
Shit, I knew it. Why didn't I believe him? They missed a new subspecies of dog, too. At least what they're all about. .
In general, mutants are like mutants. Most likely they originated from the evolution of blind dogs - in many ways they were similar. Attacking tactics are identical, and they had to run after them. .
Good thing that it was resolved at least that way, here-you deserve a reward and also, need to report these dogs Beastmaster, I think he will be interested to hear about them, in addition, he said that they have on Janova rumors about some more serious creatures than these. So don't wait too long to visit. .
I'll be sure to talk to the Beastmaster as soon as I'm on Janova. Oh, by the way, you talked about a possible mercenary assault on Skadovsk. Is it true?
No, the information has not been confirmed. Someone has put out a deceit. But as soon as they find this joker, they'll let him walk in the chowder, believe me. .
I'm from Gonta, they're having trouble on Zaton with mutants.
Shit, what else have they got?.
Voznik a new subspecies of blind dogs. It has not yet been given an official name. True, one hunter who died first found them to be similar to cerberas. I've seen them too, and even shot them. .
And blind dogs are a new subspecies. Where the Zone is going. Okay, we'll have to deal with that later. Right now, we've got some much bigger new problems here. .
What's up?. .
There's a new mutant as well. Some have already dubbed it a psevdosnork, though the resemblance to the snork is only in its behavioural pattern. These creatures are much stronger and harder to kill. Several have already died. To get together and hit their lairs is not yet possible for some reason. .
And what are these reasons?.
These critters are only active at night, and places where there have been recorded cases of their attacks on stalkers, and without these critters are dangerous even during the day. At nighttime it is unlikely that anyone will go there, even for a lot of money. .
And how much will you offer to whoever agrees to slaughter the critters?
Thirty thousand, cash immediately.
I agree to go to the pseudosnorks.
Good! I knew you'd sign up for this, then wait until nightfall and come up to me and I'll tell you where their lairs are. .
Where are the burrows of these critters?.
So you first have to go to the tunnels near the Jupiter, where you killed the Burer, then to the Jupiter factory - there are more of them.
I'll try to be done by dawn.
You'd better do your best, I hope you're loaded up on armor-piercing ammo. They're hardy creatures - only with armor-piercing, or better yet from an Ejector. Good luck, stalker. .
I'll be back, get your money ready.
The money will depend on how you come back - by yourself or in a zinc....
That's it. I've wiped out four large groups of these critters.
Fine, Major. Here comes the promised thirty thousand.
Have you reported these creatures to the scientists yet?
What makes you think they'd be so interested? You think Herman and Ozersky have nothing better to do right now? They are busy working on some new setup, don't know which one. .
That's weird, they didn't tell me anything like that, where did you get that information?
I have a source of my own, a reliable one. He says that our scientists signed a contract with a group, but for what - no one knows.. .
I don't think there's anything to worry about, mali what they can supply to the factions. It's not a big deal. .
Hmmm, then why, when I talked about possible mutant problems they only brushed it off. As if they knew what. Creature activity is really hot right now-you've seen that yourself plus there's a whole new species on the rise.
All right Zveroboy, I think you're too suspicious - the main thing is that we got rid of the pseudo-snorks, and the rest will sort itself out somehow. True, about the scientists' contract, I'll take that under advisement. Maybe I'll learn something.
Bye, then.
Listen Nazar, I've been meaning to ask you. Didn't your faction used to be called Clear Sky? .
In essence, yes. Once upon a time, most members of Dawn were indeed Clear Sky, but we've accounted for most of the mistakes made by the previous leadership, and I can say that in many ways we are now different from Clear Sky. .
What kind of errors? .
First and foremost it's about the combat training of the fighters and the uniforms and weapons used. Maybe an AKSU and MP-5 would do for the marshes, but it will not do for the centre here. And our ideology is a little different now. Now we are more like the "duty". .
Are you aware of exactly how the majority of the Clear Sky clan died?
Unfortunately, I don't have the exact details. When Lebedev and Kalancha followed the mercenary on the road through Limansk to the ChAES, I knew it would end badly. Until then no group had ever got so close to the centre of the Zone, with the exception of the Monoliths, who were there. Initially, this adventure Lebedev was doomed to fail. We were not strong enough to try to climb the Chernobyl alone. There were only thirty of us left at the base. Garin kept in touch with Lebedev till the end - till the ejection. .
And then what happened? .
As soon as it became clear that everyone who went to Chernobyl was dead-we made the decision to leave the swamps. Maraders seemed to be waiting for this moment, attacking us when we left the base-right on the Fisherman's Farm. We fought back by miracle, though they managed to split us into two small squads. Garin and I led the one which now formed the backbone of the Dawn. We broke through the pumping station on secret paths, managed to bypass all the bandits' camps and came to the road to the Agroprom. You could count ourselves lucky. The second squad led Suslov to the Cordon. They tried to sneak past the Old Church, but they were spotted. Only five men survived, among them Shisty and Cold. I heard that Shyster had survived on Zaton, but I do not know where Kholod and the others are. Suslov with the majority of soldiers were killed near Southern Farm - they were shot at point-blank range by machine guns - and where did the bandits get them from? . . Sadly, you probably wanted to know what really happened at the Chernobyl plant during that release, didn't you.
How will you know now? All of us who were there died, except perhaps the Rifleman, but where did he go after his second quest? Nothing is known about Scar, apparently he shared the fate of the purebreds, although there is no evidence of that. The only option is to track down the shooter and ask him about the details of those days. .
I'm on it. Rumour has it Shooter is alive and may be in Pripyat, as soon as I meet him I'll be sure to ask about it. .
Would really appreciate it.
I have a thing for you.
Which one?.
What do you know about the Clear Skies faction?
Ah, about those winged ones, yes, not much. The main thing is that once tried to kill me, even hired a professional mercenary, but it did not work, although they disrupted my plans and through their fault, I lost my memory then. Now they're all gone, only a few survived and founded a new clan - I think they call them "Dawn" now..
What can you tell me about that day at Chernobyl when the grouping was destroyed?. .
I don't really remember anything. Mercenary of them, then nearly killed me, and then the cast went off and that's it - a failure for the year. True now I was able to restore some of the details of what happened. .
I'm listening to you carefully.
It has come to my attention that most likely the leaders of the Clear Sky clan were not killed that day, but just as they were then caught as guinea pigs in yet another "O-Consciousness" experiment. It seems to be a project called "S.T.A.L.K.E.R.". What exactly is his essence I still do not know, but I know that it is far from over. And what may result from it also no one knows.
Do you know anything more specific about Lebedev and Kalancha?
There was one clue, only it needs checking. You know the lab under Pripyat? Maybe that's where O-Consciousness was conducting the blackout phase of the project, except all traces of it have probably been destroyed, but I'd check it out if I were you. When I was making my way through Pripyat last time, I killed one of the monolith leader Charon on my way to Chernobyl. Before that I saw him with a large detachment of his men coming out of the Yubileynoye BWC, under which the laboratory is located. But he did not have any documents with him. Perhaps some of them he hid in "Jubilee", and some he left in the lab, or maybe not, so I advise you to comb the area, and see if you can find a clue.
Thank you for your help, I will do so.
Best wishes..
I've managed to clear up a few things.
Have you tracked down Shooter?.
Not only that, but here's a look at Lebedev and Kalancha's PDA and one very interesting document on the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. project
Wow, where did you dig them up, and what's the project, I've never heard of it.
Yes, me too, but it's the whole point of what's going on, and the PDAs were in the cache, in Pripyat.
And what comes out - Lebedev and Kalancha could have survived and become participants in the project, but how does that, it turns out...
Not only Lebedev, but also Scar. I have a clue as to where he is now, but here's Lebedev. That's a mystery I can't solve yet. .
But I think we can now tackle this issue together as soon as more details become known. Here - take this to work. Now it would be very helpful to track down Scar - maybe he can clear something up. I also learned the other day about Cold, the former bartender of the Clear Sky clan. He was killed along with a group of free-walkers in Pripyat near the school about a month ago. He was there on behalf of Sidorovich. It also became known that his group managed to get some information about the X-lab. It is not known where this information disappeared to. It is possible that shortly before his death, Cold managed to dump something in the stash, or maybe not. If you're in the area, see what you can find. .
I'm already on the lookout for Scar, and as for Cold, that information comes in handy, thank you very much.
I'll be waiting to hear.
Listen Shooter, do you know anything about X-labs?
Certainly I've had to visit most of them, are you interested in anything in particular?
Yes, do you have any papers or documents with you?
All in all, there's something. About X-16 laboratory which is located on the Yantar. There's a machine there in the form of a giant brain that turns people into zombies. There's just one little problem. When I managed to get copies of the original documents on the lab here in Pripyat, I was tailed by a group of blues. It was in the Kindergarten area. I had to fight back and hide the documents just in case. Only now for the life of me do not remember where exactly I buried the stash - I then slightly concussed, good thing I survived. The blues were taking revenge on me for Wolfhound, the bastards. So now I don't need these documents. If you find them, take them. For them I will not ask anything.
Thank you, maybe I'll find something.
So, did you learn anything else interesting from the documents?.
In that documentation you brought, I found something interesting. It turns out that there is a prototype of the so-called "Product #58". It's a prototype gun whose action is based on electromagnetic bullet acceleration. Simply put, there is a prototype of a gauss gun. It's not quite working, of course. But if you want, I can fix it and modify it, as I have some experience with this class of weapon. Do you want to get such a weapon?
And you're still asking? What do I have to do?
First, bring me five units of the artifact Flash to create the power cells I need. I also need to find the prototype itself. According to the records, it should be in some lab called X-8. And I'll also need a schematic for building the shrunken electromagnetic coils. Most likely to be found at the Old BWC in Pripyat. A lot of technical documentation from various laboratories has been taken there. I'm only asking 10,000 rubles for the job itself. Well, will you take the job?
Agreed. I'll try to come back soon with a prototype, artefacts and schematic.
Okay, just come to me as soon as you find all three things at once, don't drag one at a time.
Excuse me while I have other things to do. Maybe I'll drop by later.
Well, suit yourself.
That's it, I've got the components you need. When can you get to work?
Listen, I've been thinking, this is going to be harder than I thought at first.
What's the problem?
Mechanical defects in the prototype I can fix, no problem charging the batteries, but things are much worse with the coils. I haven't worked with such circuits much, and I don't have the radio elements either. So I contacted Nitrogen and he agreed to help me. So give me the prototype and the artefacts, and you take the coil schematics to Nitrogen. As soon as he makes them, I'll get on with the job. .
Okay, I'll be right there.
Yeah, you can keep the diagram from him later, I won't need it anymore anyway.
I'm from Kardan, he said you'd help him make coils for the gauss pistol. .
You see what the drunkard from Zaton is up to, he's making a gauss gun. The hell with it, he wants to do it, let him rip his anus, I may be able to make something like that soon. Give me the scheme of coils. .
Here you go. How long to wait?
The fuck knows. There's been a bit of a problem. The courier I sent to pick up the radio components hasn't been in touch for hours. And that's a problem. I can't do anything without the parts. So you'll have to find him.
Fuck it. So what do you suggest we start our search with?.
This question is probably best answered by Hawaiian, as this courier works for him first and foremost. And with us Janowski, only when he has time..
Gavaetz, where's your courier? He and Azot owe us an item and he has not contacted us, we were getting worried.
Yeah, there was an incident with him. Some guys from Svoboda got the drop on him. He sort of owed them something too, so they're keeping him in the East Tunnel now. Until he pays the debt, he'll get out of there. .
Yeah, how in the world did he get so screwed up. So what do you think, should we go over there and sort it out?".
And you don't know how to get screwed, Major? You go, maybe you'll get a deal, if it's important. If not, the freedom fighters can kill him - they won't get away with it. .
I'll go talk to those freedom fighters then.
Go ahead, don't break any wood.
Halt, peeps! What have you forgotten?
You need to relax, man - it's not good to be waving a gun around. I got a case.
Since when do goblins do business with freemen? А? I don't like you, nah. Get the fuck out of here before you get whacked.
Hey, how long have you been in Freedom? I don't trust your talkative voice.
Am I a Sberbank to inspire confidence in you? How long are you going to mumble?
Come on, you've got a freeman sitting here, I need to have a word with him and fast.
You're as quick as mammoth diarrhea, motherfucker! This guy owes us a little. So if you pay us what you owe us, you can talk to him for the rest of your life... We'll let him go. .
How much?.
Well, ten thousand.
Hold it, and let it pass.
Yes, please, it's time to get out of here.
Cheaper to shoot you, you green bitch.
Fuck him!
Thank you brother, bailed me out. Ouch, you're the guy Nitrogen makes coils for, I was just bringing him the parts... Sorry about that.
Where are the radio parts?
When they offered to "talk" to me about the debt, I already didn't think it would work out. And the details, even as soon as I saw them from afar, I managed to hide them in a hiding place in the bushes. I marked it on the map. And about the ransom money, if you spent it, do not worry, there are a couple of valuable artifacts in the cache, so they should cover your expenses. Thanks again for helping me out.
First_talking.
There you go, pick up your radio components. And don't trust the couriers much anymore.
Thank you for doing his job - only I have been able to do without them, good thing I found in the stash a couple of necessary transistors, but I did not tell you, but I coped earlier - you do not have to wait. .
What am I supposed to do with these transistors?.
Give them to me here, and you'll get a small fee along with the coils, so to speak - liquidated damages for your extra work.
Okay, here you go.
There's a reel and a little present for you - I don't need it anyway.
Thank you. Good luck, master.
Same to you....
I brought you the coils from Azot. Now will you be able to finish the gauss gun?.
I have everything I need now, come see me tomorrow and don't forget to pay the ten thousand.
Okay. Just, Kardan, don't send the couriers, please!.
Huh, heard from Azot that they had to sweat the coils. But enough talk, I've got work to do - come and see me tomorrow. .
What - finish the job? .
That's it, your gun is ready. You can take it away now. I've ordered some more coils from Nitrogen, so if it breaks, you can contact me, I'll fix it. .
Thank you very much, Kardan, here's your money.
Goodbye.
Listen, don't you have something better to do for me?
Seriously you say. Alright, just in time you are. Just be warned, if you screw up or try to bail, you'll be hanging out at the top of the dockside crane alive until the crows eat you.
So why don't I quit if it's so serious?
No, Uncle, put your back into it, I have something that might interest you very much, or rather I'll know where to find it. .
Which one, if it's not a secret?.
And when you've done the work, you'll know, by the way, I'll pay you handsomely - with artifacts. I think you will be satisfied.
OK, what do you want to do?
And here's the thing: Generally speaking, there is an illegal channel supplying high quality Afghan heroin in the Zone. And as you might have guessed, I control it. It's insanely lucrative selling drugs through the Zone. You say you're bringing scientists artifacts through the perimeter, but you're actually carrying containers full of heroin. But that's beside the point.
Solid business, nothing to say. Here they are all about the artifacts and artifacts, drugs are unlikely to think about....
So. I heard a rumor that some of the smugglers among the free stalkers hired by me - decided to lose part of the scheme to bypass me: well, the guys do not want to share, that's it. So we need to stop this outrage. In short, go to the agreed point, they will be waiting for you, you will introduce yourself that I'm here for the new shipment.They will have to send you the coordinates of the caches with the cargo. After neatly roll them, take out all there is in geocaches and bring me up, got it?
Yeah, how much clearer. I'll be there soon.
And look, they were to throw in a flash drive in a cache, there is information "top secret"-about suppliers and resellers, if anything happens to it or you try to copy - blame yourself, I warned you.
From Chapai?. .
From him.
Good, 'cause we've been waiting. Did you bring the artifacts?
Are you bringing the cargo? .
I'll send you the info about the geocaches, you show me the container with the artifacts.
So first the coordinates, then the artifacts.
All right. Here are the coordinates, satisfied? Show me the container, or you'll get a bullet.
Let's see who else gets ee...
Take him down!.
I'm all done, pick up your cargo.
Fine, bro! That's the real fucking job. As promised, here's some artifacts from what was originally intended for stalkerna. Eh, now I'll have to look for new people, but I think I can do it without you..
You forgot to tell me about some information.
That's right, bro. I heard you're into all sorts of secret info, lab reports and other scholarly nerd stuff, right? .
Well, there is such a thing.
So, a day ago my boys observed an entertaining scene. Two mercenaries, chasing one egg-headed scientist right down the road from that idiot Noah's barge. I do not know what they were doing, but the scientist then had the temerity to go close to the station processing, and there's him blue and sketched.
And then what?.
My boys then sat near the gas station - from there the road is clearly visible - saw the blue-navigator right before the anomaly "Claw" caught up with, have time to discern that he was carrying some case, and then either ran out of ammo, or he went nuts, fuck. He went straight through the anomaly to the clefts. Well, the naims after him, then one on his feet and did not stand and went straight into the ramp, the second did not take a chance and rushed to the base. A scientist from the tunnels and never showed himself, probably died there. That's all I know. .
Thanks for the info. I wonder what he might have been carrying with him if the blues were interested in him.. .
You check it yourself. Go on, I've got things to do.
How's it going?.
What can I tell you - affairs are always affairs, nothing special - fixing, improving. Look, and you really Kardan gauss-gun made? .
Yes, not so long ago-with your help, what have you forgotten?
I didn't think he'd make it, but he's a drunk again.
Yeah, he kinda quit, and besides, he used to be an employee of the lab where the Gauss weapon was originally designed.
That's how even, well God forbid, I've also decided to put an old idea into action, can you help me out?
Yes, but that's just what's your idea?
Excuse me friend, I'm in a bit of a rush, maybe I'll come back later.
I'll wait....
Fine, I knew I could count on you. Anyway, I decided to create a new exoskeleton, or rather a nano-exoskeleton using unique technology. I used to graduate in nanotechnology long time ago, before the zone, and now I think it's time to work on my specialty. .
Nano exoskeleton - sounds cool, except I have one suggestion - I'll take the time to field test the prototype as soon as you make it.
You don't even have to bother with that one! OK, now let's get on with it. First I'd like to ask you to do the following - it's very important for me to know the opinion of other technicians who work in the Zone. Uncle Yar, Garin, and Kardan, so go tell them about my idea and ask what they think about it, and maybe they'll help me out with some advice. All the same, this is a serious matter, requires a more cardinal approach. .
Surely, I completely agree with you. I'm off to the masters now.
Just don't stay with them too long, and I'll sketch out some calculations in the meantime.
Healthy Freedom! How's it going?.
Are you making a point, or just dropping by?
From Nitrogen. He's thinking about building a nano-exoskeleton and decided to ask your opinion..
Wow. Decided to live out his long-held dream after all, I'd like to see what he can do..
So can you tell him anything?
Tell you, hmm, I think he'll do it himself - he's got the right hands and the highest degree of gold. So I think he just sent you here to show off. And if all the same he needs advice, I can tell him not to be bothered with Sevromotors - nanochevlar, which I think he is going to use is three times lighter than simple armored materials. That's why you should think of something special with the general hydraulics, to avoid using unnecessary force in vain. I think some material on hydraulics would be good for him to review. .
Thank you, if anything I'll drop in on you. And I'll tell Nitrogen exactly.
You're welcome to drop by if you have something to talk about....
Hi, Kardan. What, can you make a gauss machine gun, it's a bit small.
And gauss-granotamet at the same time, Chernobyl joker - you dropped by on business, because here I do not have much time - orders after I gave up drinking at times increased - no time to chat - that. .
I'm here for a moment, for some advice for Nitrogen. He's decided to nano-technology on exoskeletons and he's interested in other mechanics' opinions. .
He's the one who decided to work off his jealousy, not the technology. Okay, if he cares about my opinion, listen: I understand that from scratch on the bolts he will not do exoskeleton based on what is available, will remove the old armor, and a few other things at the same time, and replace them with a new one made of nanomaterials, that is, electronics and other stuffing will hardly change. So, I advise him to choose a proper example of the original exoskeleton with good internal stuffing, from which to start dancing.
Any particular option you can recommend?.
Yes, in principle, you can choose correctly. Look, an ordinary exoskeleton, which loners buy immediately falls out, because electronics there at three with a minus, it is clear that this is the very first generation, and still not even properly know how to make them, they just will be cheaper. The same way with the bandit's exoskeleton - virtually the same exoskeleton that the neutrals have, though they tweaked the electronics a little, but with hydraulics and other stuff they bumped it up a notch. Well, the Dolgov and Svoboda versions are unlikely to fit either. They have a lot of self-made stuff packed in them, and the filling is mediocre - in the Dolgov version there is more emphasis on the armour, in the Svoboda one - on weight reduction and use of lighter materials. So, nanoecksa originally material will be superlight, and will give better protection. It is worth taking a closer look at the variants of military and mercenary exoskeleton. In them all according to the highest grade made, current is not easy to get, and yet too complicated scheme they have compound parts, and electronics in the main Western goes - a lot of trouble to understand it properly will be. Well, monolithic - where will you get it, though it is also a variant. And a scientific exoskeleton is almost entirely based on nanotechnologies, there is no sense in taking it as the basis. The only remaining option is the "Dawn" or, even better, "Clear Skies" exoskeleton. They did a good job in their time. They had thought of everything, guys. And they used simple and reliable electric circuits, so there were no failures in their work. So you'd better take theirs, or if you want to be specific, the purebred, which Shusty sells. I've tried it once and I know, that everything is correct. .
Well, thank you- I'll pass it on to Nitrogen.
Good luck..
Well Kulibin, there's a talk.
Well, listen. What do you want?.
I'm on Azot's behalf. He has decided to create a nano-exoskeleton and decided to ask your advice on how best to do it.
Oh, what a bug he is. He was jealous of Kardan's know-how in gauss technologies and decided to show off too. Well, well - flag in one place and drum to him, as they say. .
So should I just tell him that you're stupidly screwing him and that's all the advice?
