No, he always has time to go to three letters, in short, I wonder what will come of his idea, because before he was even steamed about where to get a stupid box with transistors and capacitors, and then I remember even a long search for some sophisticated tools for soldering grenades. And he will need a lot of things for nanoecks. So tell him to do it, but be very careful with this base material - I've heard, that scientists tried to bring here some consignment of kevlar, but their mercenaries had intercepted it before. I think it was somewhere near the Jupiter factory. But they did not manage to grab this material, all controllers were blocked, so where is it now - beats the shit out of me. And more in the near future deliveries of nanochevlar are not expected, so that he has more trouble on his head.
Depressing though, but I guess we'll figure it out..
And you're welcome, if I find out anything new, I'll let Azot know directly.
All, I polled the mechanics, I think the effect is there.
What did you find out?
So, it's in order - Jar thinks you'll have to do a lot of work with hydros, Kardan says a Clear Sky exoskeleton is best, and Garin warns that there may be a supply shortage of nanomaterials. .
Damn, problems though, but let's approach things constructively. I've already done some sketches in the calculations, the tools are fine too, I just need to get all the consumables.
Okay, what exactly will you need?.
I'll probably take the advice of the other techs, so you'll need to get two Clear Sky exoskeletons - I've heard they're very good indeed. Next, I need to figure out what to do with the nanokevlar, and finally need a new scheme for the hydraulic boosters and sevromechanisms. .
Well, about the kevlar - Garin said that one batch was recently sown by scientists somewhere in the factory "Jupiter": like they were attacked by blues, but why would they with the material in the factory?. .
Yeah most likely the scientists wanted to shove it to the same mercenaries and more expensive, they just did not pay, they decided that so take it, except that heard there all the controllers covered. So when you go to the factory, be careful. I remember when we were going to the overpass, there was all sorts of paperwork and junk lying around. And then I found out about the overpass, that even laboratories might have been there some time ago, and a part of documentation might have got buried somewhere. Stalkers have bothered there only recently - probably not all have plundered yet - search there. It is possible that the information about the hydraulic boosters may not be directly connected with their use in the exoskeletons, but indirectly. There in the overpass of these amplifiers with the help of which the compartments were divided not one or two - I think you'll find what you need.. .
And the exoskeletons, and why would you need two?
One for parts will go and the other will form the basis. I think just one exoskeleton you're better off in Shusty ordering, and about the second, recently Senka drunkenly blabbed that they say one of his friends had recently purchased just a "Clear Sky" exoskeleton, and left it in his stash. And this is his stash on "Jupiter"- just on your way will be, maybe, and you'll find it there.
Good, then I'm off.
Yeah, you'll come to me as soon as everything you need is available, well good luck.
Well, I've got everything you need. When can you get to work now?.
Fine major. You've already done most of your work, but I don't think you can put an end to it just yet.
I don't get it, what else are you up to? Isn't all the stuff I brought along enough to make a nano-exoskeleton?
To create a simple nano-exoskeleton, yes, but I decided to go a little further and create a whole new groundbreaking class of armor.
What do you mean by new class?
A few hours ago Garin contacted me and told me some surprising things. He's learned that it is possible to use some technology to create nearly invisible objects. .
Is that an invisible suit?.
In principle, yes. A group of scientists have managed to develop technology that allows them to create, if not completely invisible objects, then, say, translucent ones that would be practically invisible from a distance of more than 50 meters. And that only if you know exactly where you want to look and what you want to see..
How's the miniculture of bloodsuckers?. .
Well almost, it's not the point. The main thing is that the professor, who was engaged in this development - Mironov seems to be his last name - is now in Pripyat. How he got there I don't know, information is very scarce. Exactly it is known that he is alive and is in a military base. There is information that his group was attacked by monoliths. So I think that you better go to Pripyat and meet with this professor. .
Okay, but you still get to work, maybe your info is fake and there's no way to create invisible objects.
Maybe you're right, but you'd better check....
Hello, Professor. I need to talk to you about something.
Ask, young man, only now I'm unlikely to be able to help you.
But what happened? Why can't you do me a small favour, privately so to speak?
Listen, why do I have to answer your questions? Who are you anyway, maybe you're just a mercenary sent by my competitors.... .
I am Major Diagterev, SBU. Now will you answer my questions, Professor?
I didn't think the SBU would be intrigued by my work either. But believe me, I really can't help you anymore. If you're interested in my research into partial mimicry, it's irretrievably lost. Those barbarians stole everything as soon as we entered Pripyat. .
Who exactly?
It was the sectarians of the Monolith faction. They killed all my guards, I still don't know why they didn't kill me too. They have all my research results now. .
Why are you in such an inopportune place, and even more so without proper military cover?
In the Zone I work as a private citizen and unfortunately no longer cooperate with the official authorities. Therefore, the military only came to my rescue when it was already over. The military have no use for me, it is good that at least they did not consider me some sectarian and did not shoot him on the spot. .
It's clear, but at least where were you attacked?.
This was not far from the Books shop. Major, I have no way of contacting my employers yet, so for now I'm stuck here indefinitely. As soon as my superiors manage to hire a mercenary unit, I'll leave town. It's a pity, but my labours will remain in the hands of the monoliths. Eh, if the military could afford to give me a squad of at least ten men, we could try to wrest them away from the sectarians. .
Yeah, I don't think so. Wait, what did you say it was like to fight off the monoliths with your documents? .
The case that holds all the papers is equipped with an electronic transmitter and is still active right now. Most likely, the monoliths attacked us purely by accident and have not yet realized what important documents have fallen into their hands.. .
Why didn't you say something before? So, where's the signal coming from now?
Can you organise a sabotage group? But...
No buts, Professor, I am also interested as a private person and therefore will get your case myself, hand over the coordinates.
If as an individual. Good - it's not far from here at all. Just keep in mind, there were at least ten of them, do you think you can handle it alone?
If in doubt, I wouldn't try it...
I believe that if you manage to return everything, then we can continue the conversation, and only as a private person will I be able to answer your questions.
Hold your case Professor, now can we have a chat about the issues I'm interested in?
You managed to single-handedly defeat a squad of monoliths? I'm impressed, Major. Well, what exactly did you want to discuss?
Results of your research: I'm interested in the possibility of creating invisible objects, I think you have such technology? .
And let me ask, what do you want to make invisible?
armoured suit..
Well, I think I can help you, now I'll make you a copy of some stuff.
Fine. I knew we could be mutually beneficial to each other.
Here you go - here's everything you need.
Thank you.
And make sure these materials only get into the right hands.
Azot, I got the documents you need. Here you go.
Wow, I didn't expect you to be able to dig them up. I've already made a complete nano exoskeleton sample, all that's left to do is make modifications to give the mimicry effect. .
How long will it take?
No more than 24 hours.
Okay, I'll stop by tomorrow.
All will be ready.
Are you done with your work?
Yes, here you go - a prototype nano-exoskeleton invisible.
Cool, what did you give the artifact for?
You see, there's only one flaw - the mimicry is achieved by increasing the background radiation - it's the only flaw, but it's fixable through the use of artifacts.
It's still awesome. Even against a tank with bare hands.
Well against a tank I wouldn't advise it, after all you're not immortal. Otherwise, it's probably the best option. Okay, good luck, test it. .
Can you help with something?
It will all depend on how much this issue concerns our syndicate.
So much so that it's up to you. Are you contracting with the Liberty faction?
My brigade is not. For others, I am not responsible.
Well, a hint as to who exactly might have been concluding?.
Any information is quite expensive, mine for example is thirty thousand. I think you'll be very interested in it.
OK, here you go.
Sorry, money's tight.
Come back when they do.
It means that among us it's not customary to reveal the cases of other groups, you can get shot by one of your own at a time, but this case falls under a special paragraph and I can talk. .
I'm listening carefully.
It's been suggested that a conspiracy against the syndicate has arisen, and perhaps not just against the syndicate. But I have no proof of that - only conclusions, which are worthless. .
Maybe you're right, won't you share your conclusions?
On your topic. There was a contract recently between the northeastern brigade and the libertarians, only it was very dubious. To be more exact, this contract was also offered to us, but we have a lot to do here, and it demanded almost all soldiers of the brigade. And the whole contract seemed so bogus.
And who was the mediator? .
You're wondering that too, okay- a man came to the base, through my guide- so clean, I thought. Introduced himself as Varg, said, "It's a good deal, but it needs a lot of payback. I offered him a good price, but I still refused, and I already told you that I was not up to it yet. But if he'd needed only ten men, he'd have agreed, but he needed at least thirty. And this Varg himself... ...he looked so familiar.
What about the northeast brigade?. .
And they were broke then - they were offered one-time contracts for two or three people. And here it was for the whole brigade at once. So Jason signed for himself and his Argonauts. Although, too, doubts ripened in him.
Yes, which ones?
Well, at first they were fine: sort of secure the caravan, control the supply of weapons so no soul would go anywhere near them. And then the freedman Varg says, they will have to deal with a couple of Drogov. Well, Jason was writing to me afterwards - we are screwed, we signed up for provocation. I said to him: maybe it would be better to leave - you will stand between two fires: "Freedom" and "Duty". They will eat you with the shit of a pseudo-giant. You know, Jason, like, we're the best. Anyway, they were all fucked up. And for that I have got - Debtors of Jason with brigade, together with the freedom fighters, whom Varg has sent to help to protect weapons - in two accounts. It turned out that the contract was a real fake - all were killed. .
That's a sad thing to say, but I just want to tell you one thing. The Warg you mentioned was not for Freedom, but for the "Duty" - their infiltrator.
Is that even how it comes out - so "The Debt" benefited from this whole mess?
I don't know. Varg is officially a Dolg man, except he wasn't acting on their orders at the time. There's a little man called Anubis, he's a libertarian, he was in control of the whole thing. And after eliminated Warg and the Dowgov, who took part in the massacre of the mercenaries and the "freedom. .
How the fuck does it work-it looks like Freedom set this whole thing up and covered its tracks themselves.
Not really. Anubis probably isn't exactly a pure libertarian either, seems to be just a cover. I do not know who he may be, but he plays big. Struggles clans on the plain - but why? .
I want to figure it out too. When Hog gets back from under Limansk, I'll have him digging under that Anubis of yours -- he's probably an agent too, but not a Freeman or military one, that's for sure. Whose is it? That's the question. Well, let's leave it at that- I've got an idea, and you're going to help me. .
OK, willingly I will.
It wasn't that long ago that Ridge's squad was wiped out on Zaton. He had some very valuable data stored in his laptop. Who took it I do not know - people say some pro goblins. But that laptop went to the side - someone on "Skadovsk. So, go to Zaton and try to find this information - I do not think that this information was sold on.. .
I'm on my way.
Only with corpses all over the place, we can still use "Skadovsk"...
Hey, remember that laptop I brought you from the shops? I need it back, have you sold it yet?
Oh, how it turned out, only I have my own interest in this, so whiten your slippers fraero, with me scam will not pass, and I do not take kickbacks either.
You shouldn't do that, Rennie .... You'll soon be bringing me that laptop in your teeth, wagging your tail.
You fucking goblin, you know who you're messing with? My roof will cut you up and feed you to the dogs at the junkyard. Get the fuck out of here before they really lock you up. .
Tell me, Beard, what do you know about Raccoon?
Yeah, what can I say about him - a cheap condom, that's what he is, a cheapskate and a rare scum, but his product is consistently good - so he hangs on, although the prices overdo it.
And what do you know about his roof?
The roof is a local gang - not the Sultans, that's for sure. But the guys are serious too - not losers with rifles. Rich supplies them with good gear - that's a fact. Except these guys are a real pain in the ass for ordinary stalkers. Hunting only those who come back from raids and loaded. They're probably tipped off by Sych himself, though that's not for sure. In a word, they're reckless. It's high time to kill them, but no one gets around to it. .
I can take care of that, because Sych is really starting to get a little bit cocky - not good for him.
That's good. So, this gang is unlikely to appear here this afternoon, and tomorrow I gather they're planning a raid. That's when you'll get them. I'll send you a message.
Well, Cheechara, there goes your gang. Come on, give me the laptop and we'll go our separate ways. .
Fuck the roof, the other one will be better than the old one, but I should thank you for fixing it, it was useless anyway. As for the mercenary's laptop, I sold it. Courier left about an hour ago. But the coordinates of his PDA I'll let you know in time to intercept it do what you want, but do not kill - there is a serious customer.
You're a bitch, Raccoon. Alright, I'll catch up with the courier, and I'll talk to you later...
Let's talk...
That's it, Major. No nonsense, you try to shoot, the syndicate will open a hunt for you....
Why the hell did you kill him?
Witness, and it wouldn't have done any good anyway - he managed to get the laptop to the customer. My men were watching him. And then you showed up and spooked the bird. .
Couldn't you interrogate him, then sew him up?
Mayor, don't get cocky - don't you think it's not in your position to be pushing rights right now? Just because Molfar's men didn't shoot you doesn't mean you're clean and can do business with us on an equal footing. .
what do you mean?
About what? Need I remind you how the laptop got to Raccoon? I'll take that as a verbal warning, one more stunt like that's gonna cost you. But as long as you live, it's to our advantage that you're in this mess now too. And about that courier... We caught him giving the laptop to a Libertarian - can't you guess who?
Anubis, the creature...
He is the one. He's the reason I'm here. He owes us too much.
What do you know about him?
Anubis is one of the most professional saboteurs working in the Zone. Who his masters are is unknown to me, but that he is a special agent is beyond doubt. He's been on our radar for a long time. He was involved in the death of one of the southwestern brigades two years ago in the Dark Valley. Then he managed to pit us against the freedom fighters, and he's sentenced to death in absentia. That alone will not solve the whole problem. .
The fact that Anubis is not a libertarian I realized long ago, I know he has wide connections as in "The Debt", possibly among the freemen as well. Then why did Molfar pretend he didn't know anything? .
You better not go to him yet, or he'll shoot the hell out of you for Hook, Backbone and the rest. I could barely get him not to kill you. Molfar found out the other day, and he didn't believe me. I helped him to sort it all out. .
What are you going to do? .
The people behind Anubis have most likely commissioned him to carry out a large-scale sabotage of the Zone, targeting the major groups-Dolga, Liberty, and us. The aim is most likely to be our general weakening against the others.
Are you counting the Monolith as others?. .
Not only. Other sectarians from the south of the Zone have recently become active.
"Sin"?.
Themselves. So far they're not really hustling here, but it's only a matter of time. The most plausible version is that Anubis is a sinner. That alone explains what he's doing.
Then why didn't you kill him now that he was in your people's sight?.
For me personally, he's already worked out - I'll kill him when I see fit. The main thing now is that he will lead me to those who are behind him. .
You let me know then, I need to ask them some questions too.
No doubt, all scattered....
Hello, brother. Need any help?.
It's very much required. It's good that you stopped by. There is a very urgent matter, and I think you're the best man for it.
I am willing to do your bidding.
Our brothers were recently attacked, killing everyone who was there. It happened not far from here, near the Gastronome building. In addition, some very important information concerning research into mimicry was stolen. These papers would have been of great use to me in creating a unique weapon that almost blends in with the surrounding area.
Creating invisible weapons, hmmm. That would go really well with the invisible armour suit.
Some of our brothers at Chernobyl are working on making semi-invisible suits, while I'm supposed to deal with our weapons here in Pripyat. But without materials I can't make it happen. I beg you very much, return the lost documents.
Where can I find them? .
Our scouts have reported that the documents have been handed over to a scientist who was in a fortified military point. Now he, accompanied by a detachment of free stalkers, has left the city, presumably via the Pripyat-1 overpass. Find them there, kill him and all infidels, and return the documents to me.
I'll be back soon.
The power of Monolith is with you, brother.
Professor and stalkers destroyed, brother. Here-it's his document case.
Fine, now let's see... As I suspected... I'm missing one very necessary component. It can be obtained artificially from one very rare artefact. .
Which artefact? .
The artefact is called the Devil's Egg and is very difficult to find. But you will have to do it, brother.
Where to look for it approximately? .
The Devil's Egg hasn't been found very often. But there is a chance, especially now. There is a chance that it will occur even in Pripyat. So far it has only been found inside closed rooms, near special anomalous fields. There aren't many of them here. Only the Vine and Vulcan anomalies form such fields. So it's best for you to look for the artefact there.
I will find it.
Okay, only you'll need to use an Omega-class detector to search, you can't detect the Egg with any other device.
Here you go - I've managed to find the artefact.
I now have everything I need to create a unique weapon pattern. I decided to create one based on a gauss cannon.
I think it would then be the ultimate weapon.
That's the way it's going to be, brother. I'll start refining it immediately. And while I'm at it, you'll be doing me one more favor.
But only under the condition that I take it upon myself to test your wonder weapon.
Of course, brother-you are worthy of this, but first you will need to activate some of our special devices-modular reducers. They work in conjunction with the repeaters you already know. Disguised as plain old generators. Our brethren managed to covertly place them in hidden locations, but there was no need to use them then. Now the time has come to use them.... .
Give me the coordinates. I'll see what I can do.
There are three in total. You can start with any one, while I take care of the weapons, good luck brother. .
All modular gearboxes are working again.
That's great bro, I'm done with the cannon too. Here, take it away - a truly unique weapon.
That's for sure. I'm off to test it on the infidels of Monolith.
Let the Monolith illuminate your uneasy path, stranger....
Who will you be?
I'm from Varg.
I get it. Don't pay much attention to my guys. Our nerves are all on edge. We don't trust anyone. Sometimes even our own. Varg said we might have a snitch, but I don't buy it.
This is information he didn't give me. But more to the point. As I see it, you've got the tongue thoroughly nailed. So what can you tell me about Blue's connection to Freedom? I'm concerned if any of them have any data on large shipments of weapons and equipment. .
Wait a minute, militaryal, not so fast. If it's about that mercenary you're after, you can gank him - there's not a penny more to be gained from him. We've learned enough to start the main operation. The mercenary told us that they had received a large contract, initially just for guarding and escorting a shipment, but that they were asking for more. Soon they were attacking several of our artifact hunters, but you already know that. He also knows that an underground warehouse will be set up near here any day now, and that the main hires will be arriving at the same time. The mercenaries have already posted patrols in the area and that is the biggest problem right now. They will prevent you from approaching the warehouse in secret. .
And you want me to eliminate them? .
I need to secure an escape for both my guys and further simplify the work of the strike quads. You see we're working incognito, under the guise of mere free walkers. Engaging in open combat we categorically forbidden, there are special combat quads. Our work is of a different kind. But when we took this little dove, we had to make some noise. You know how it is. Now it's those same patrols that could be looking for us. The mercenaries have set up three patrols. Two closer to the tunnels, one patrolling along our escape route to the cement factory. Please remove those patrols, it'll help us get closer to the tunnels. I will tell you about the rest later.
I'll do it, don't worry.
How's it going?
Mercenary patrols destroyed. True, it was a bit of a struggle.
Fine. Now listen carefully. The mercenaries don't always come to the tunnel, there are often freedom fighters with them. There are about fifteen or twenty men in all. Snipers - from above on the platform and in the windows. One group is always downstairs and the rest are always inside the compound. They also bring in new merchandise from time to time. The main customers should be here any day now. That's why you need to talk to Shulga right away. I think he'll coordinate with Varg, and then we can go up against Freedom and blow the place clean. That's all the intel we could dig up. That's it, we need to move to the assembly point. .
Bye, debtor.
Good luck, stalker.
Shulga said for me to come and see you. Do you have some business?"
No mate, now you have a case and I have to prepare you for it and give you a quick briefing.
doesn't understand shit.
Now you'll understand, pick up the regular uniforms, equipment and weapons of the rank-and-file fighter of our faction here. I've given you twice as much ammunition as I should have, but you've got a bigger task ahead of you. Introduction: we need to move to a specified point, to clear the area of mutants and find a missing man in the area. Is the task clear? .
No friend, hooey. That's not the way things are done. Without my consent, moreover, I'm not a member of your faction....
Consider yourself temporarily seconded by your commanders to us sympathisers. And here's getting your secondment, I think they'll suit you.
Fair enough, but still, what's the point of this circus. What, Shulga couldn't say directly.
So he couldn't. There is an opinion that there is a mole on Janov, and a serious one, it is not clear who he works for, but the information is leaking is a fact, so the instruction you received from me. Our counter-intelligence, with Varg at the helm, is just a handshake. And svobodivtsy are trying to fend them off, as if they are not involved. .
Is this all to do with what happened to your artifact collectors?.
Possible. The blues aren't just going to attack anybody, and it's not artifacts they're after - only bandits can do that. On show provocation smells like that. But who hired the blues? .
Any thoughts?. .
Freemen fear and swear they're not involved, stoners don't do business with blues. They'll attack whoever they want, there's no reason for them to give money to the side. Sinners - they even more fucked up than the stone-dwellers, but why the fuck should they do that? .
Are there any penitents around here? I have not heard.
Last night a group was spotted near Kopaci. We don't know where they came from and we don't know what they are after. We wanted to follow them, but the Dawn Guards scared them off. More nikami information do not have.. .
not much....
Warg will tell you the rest later, but in the meantime, deal with the mutants - we think that too, they have appeared at the cement, and I think we saw poltergeists and zombies. They've never been here before and not in such numbers. It looks like a wave from Pripyat. Besides, our man who went missing there was working with Varg. And it's very important that you find him. The scout himself is on another mission, so take the initiative in your hands and do not linger there.
I'll be there soon.
Good luck, you'll need it.
...became...vrg...suk...a.warg...e.

...go...vrg...uhh...kill...ehhh...

Good morning, Comrade Lieutenant Colonel. How's it going?

Okay, what about the supply of artifacts, since the scientists don't care who brings them in as I assume?
If the urge is there, take it to the scientists, again if you discover it. But I have a hunch that it's just a load of artefacts that's the problem. Probably, the bandits have prykarili, but still, you figure it out yourself.
Hello.
Healthily, and why the fuck aren't you getting in touch?
Don't be angry, it's from Shulga - you can tell him it's fine. It's just that the anomalous field is rabid here. All frequencies are jammed. .
Okay, but I was told by the lieutenant colonel to pick up the cargo and carry it to the scientists, and also to check on your partner.
He went to the Floats, and there the connection is always fine; maybe something could have happened to him. As for the artifacts - if the lieutenant colonel ordered it, then take them, but do not try to hide with them.
I'll try.
Well, cheers.
I'm on behalf of Shulga.
Yes, yes I'm listening to you.
I brought artifacts on delivery from Dolg.

Good day..
Good day..
Your fears are partially confirmed, Comrade Lieutenant Colonel.

Will solve the problem, and with your help, by the way here's for your efforts, and also - look at the captain Zvyagintsev - our procurer. He had business with you.

good..

I was informed that you wanted to have a word with me, Comrade Lieutenant Colonel.

I wonder why they didn't attack themselves then - after all they could have done just as well. Why sign someone on the side. Are they afraid of something? .

What exactly?. .

Why look for him - he's not far from Janov.

Funny, usually mercenaries are only offered a one-off.

How do you know that - maybe you're a mercenary yourself, but in the "duty" so "stupid number"? .

And don't, you tell me what you know and then Shulga and I will decide what to do. After all, he's the one who asked me to help, not you.
You were asked by the "Duty", not the lieutenant colonel - don't forget!
You're going to tell me more about your ideas, where were you while we were holding mutants back, you could have helped? .
I did something that probably won't cause more breakthroughs like this. So enough bullshit, chief - listen as you used to, if you don't want to have a nice conversation: it is known that a group of mercenaries may have been hired to cover and protect a major new arms supply channel. The alleged employer is Freedom, but I'm not sure - the weapons are obviously not meant for them: they're probably middlemen too. Sabotage against us was planned by freedom fighters, but clearly under someone's orders - that's what we have to find out. .
This is already good. Anything else you can report?.
Yes, you need to meet my snitch at Liberty and find out what he knows. I'll see you again afterwards.
Where to find your man and then leave him or is he expendable?
He promised to get in touch tonight, he'll tell you the place. And if anything happens, his own people will take him out. I'll be in touch. Interrogate the bastard and come to me.
I got it, I'll do it.
Good and relax Major, it's not good for us to fight over nonsense. Maybe we'll cross paths again.
Stall, don't move. Who is?
You put the gun away, I'm talking to Varg.

What do you got?.
In general, the usual. Standard report - expenses of the faction, Loki's contacts with his superiors, plus a list of new members who joined the faction in the last week. Also... .
That's the usual - you report to Varg personally, me on the subject - what do you know about your contract with the blues?
There is certainly something to say - but not much.
Say what you have.
Okay. The contract was made a week ago - one of the local merchants has established a new particularly large channel of supply of artifacts from the Zone and equipment from the Big Land. With goblins he's all set there, they've secured passage through Kordon. And here in the Zone - we'll have to strain ourselves to deliver the cargo safely in both directions. But it is not the main thing - illegal deliveries were, are and will be, there is nothing that can be changed. The point is that the weapons and equipment should not go to us or to the blues, but somewhere on the side. .
Why bother hiring each other and getting by with nothing, why even bother--someone else could have done it all.
That's the problem - there's an idea that Loki doesn't even know what's going on, or if he does, not all of it.
Explain..
Such a theme, in short, about the control of supply he gave our guys orders - I heard myself, but the attack on the Drogovtsy was out of the question - we're kind of like a peace agreement with you here unspoken, but there's a - you know. .
And who controls the delivery from your side, if not Loki personally?.
This one, friend, I don't know. But also not the last person - he definitely did not appear on Janov - probably from our main base on the Militar. .
All right, well, who do you think might be the customer of the cargo if not your clan?.
I don't know, just a personal guess-perhaps someone who is a fanatic. But it's only a guess.
All right, you be careful, and I'll get back to Varg, I think he's found something in the meantime too.
I will, that's my job.
What's up, Major, talk to the snitch?
Talked, disappointingly - he thinks Loki has nothing to do with it.

He doesn't know, but thinks the ultimate customer may be one of the sectarian clans. .

What's Sin? These penitents rarely stick their noses further than the Redwoods. They don't used to go near Dark Vale, not much better than bandits or Renegades and Blackslugs. Same thing. This is only later they were so brainwashed, that even more fanatical monoliths have. .
Stange, I heard that a lot of sinners among the "Free Stalkers"-like your snitchy Gusak-anywhere sniffing. And they can not be called bandits. .
Hey, spetsura, how long have you been in the Zone? Trust my experience - "Sin" is hardly capable of such a thing. They would have stupidly made a raid from Pripyat, and would have put half of the local tramps without any of the arcane intricacies. Something else is different here. .
What do you think?
We'll find out soon enough. In short, Shulga has given the go-ahead for the operation. After all, the fact remains that the Mercenaries and Svoboda have been spotted. This is already enough to untie the "duty"'s hands. It doesn't matter if they started it themselves or if someone put them up to it. In general, they need to conduct reconnaissance, specifically to cut off the supply line. .
How do you have something specific in mind?
Yes, a quad of our agents disguised as free-riders have scoured almost all around, trying to figure out where the mercenaries with the libertarians have a staging area. They almost succeeded - most likely the Eastern tunnels near "Jupiter". They'd been seeing a lot of activity in the tunnels, both Freemen and Blues. And yesterday - Marmedon - the commander of the scouts reported that they seem to have started to bring weapons and equipment there. .
Then they should all get their asses kicked there.
You'll get there, Major. Now meet up with those agents and check out what's going on around that place-get more intel and be careful not to spook the bigger bird. Although not the fact that it will arrive. .
I get it, I perform.
I'll report to my commander in the meantime to start working out an assault plan. And with Shulga there is something to coordinate..
So isn't Shulga your immediate superior?
My friend, mind your own business and don't ask unnecessary questions. Shulga is far from being the first man in the Duty - it's just that he heads all our quads north of Limansk. Well, goodbye.
Comrade Lieutenant Colonel, I think the situation has been cleared up.

It has come to light that the Freedmen, together with their mercenaries, are in control of a cargo transfer point in the East Tunnel area.

Yes, totally forgot-your honestly earned ones, and as for the sinners-if we find out anything, we'll let you know. Good luck.
Hello, Beard. I've got a case for you. I'm in desperate need of a vigilante, and he's gone missing. You wouldn't happen to know where he's gone, would you?

How nice that we met! You'll have to excuse me, I had some very important things to do, I couldn't wait for you. I told Beard to tell you that I left here. So, how was the mission? Did you... hand over the explosives to Kanevsky?
Yes, passed it on. Kanevsky's PDA miraculously survived the explosion, but I could not use it - there is some incredible protection, I had to give Azot. You know, you should have at least warned me what was really in those "fireworks". I almost got blown up in there, too. Of course I suspected something, the parcel looked too much like a well-packaged C-4, but I didn't even think about this turn of events. Why were you even putting on a show like that in the first place? Why did you kill that Debtor, and in such an... unusual way? An old score?
Well, thank you! You've earned your reward! Now to answer your questions. No, I did not have any "old scores" against Kanevsky. The point is completely different. The death of Kanevsky played a crucial role - the fate of Zaton and everyone else who trades there in the search for artifacts largely depended on this man. Kanevsky kept electronic copies of some documents, and I have the originals, so the loss of his PDA is nothing. Here are the coordinates of my cache, in addition to the documents there you will take everything else as payment for the work. .
But his PDA had to be given to the debtors, right?
I think "The Debt" is hardly involved here, and acted on his own accord, but with someone else's tip-off. It all looks like a planned sabotage, but who was planning it? Anyway, you'll read the documents and then decide what to do. Okay, goodbye, I have to go.
Good luck, and be careful.
I will.
Greetings, Warden. I happen to be in possession of a DA of one of your men.
What?! Kanevsky is dead?!
Well... yes. I found his corpse on Zaton, and picked up the PDA from him. I've already given it to Azoth, and I brought you some documents in the original so to speak, after all, "The Duty" needs to find out what happened to his man. And get to the bottom of it. .
Good job, Major. I appreciate such people and will not leave you without reward. And as for Kanevsky, I think there was no need to drag him into this story, I think Varg himself would have coped, but as it happened - may his eternal memory.
And why would Varga do all this? .
Listen, don't ask too many questions - Varg is our best intelligence agent and he doesn't answer to me, but to Voronin or his deputies directly. So take what you can, "Duty" will not forget, and if I find out anything out about what I think is a fake alliance with bandits, I'll let you know. .
Don't you think it's odd, even for a Dolgian scout, to collude with bandits, and for such a dubious purpose?
Why is it dubious, surely Varg would just sniff out all the local gangs and then we'd hit them with a single blow. Don't you believe it? .
No. There was one stalker - The Avenger - he managed to find out a lot about this mess with the bandits and I think it's not what you think. .
Where is this Avenger of yours?.
dead, killed by bandits.
Yes, then I'll follow Varg's next steps, but so far his actions have never come under suspicion. And you in turn go to Zaton and warn the inhabitants of Skadovsk of a possible attack from the bandits. .
OK, I'm on my way.
Good luck.
Hi!.
Oh, man! Good to see you! What you came for!
I thought I'd warn you and your rastamans. If you don't do something about it soon, "The Debt" will take control of Zaton and then knock you out. And he wants to do it in a very cunning way, not getting dirty himself, but using the local gangs. .
Fucking hell! That's some info, man! How do you prove it?
And with what. Here's the paperwork. This belonged to Kanevsky, you probably know him, Shulga's man. Don't make such round eyes, and read, read to the end, there are many more interesting things there. .
It seems true, I could not even think that the "Duty" is planning such a ... Well, let's go, let's help Zaton, gather all forces and steel fist, so to speak, cover all bandits and Dungov, so they for the lack of forces, not only for Jupiter, but for "Janov" could not stick their noses out. And keep the new gear - we can not leave such information without reward. .
And what exactly are you going to do? .
I think my trusted person will handle this - he's a master of his craft and will be able to find the right solution. And to be honest I'm confused that The Debt was able to stoop to an alliance with the Bandits, it's probably not that simple after all. That's why there's no way around it without Anubis. .
You'd better plug it in. And tell him that one stalker, who managed to steal the documents from the dolgovtsy already killed by bandits and there is no way to delay.
Okay, then if this isn't a setup after all and the bandits are really getting ready to attack Skadovsk, you'd better warn the locals about the threat. .
Okay, I'll do it.
Good luck.
I have extremely important information.
Bah! What people on our ship! Well, did you find your Avenger?
Yeah, found it... Anyway, I'll get straight to the point: thanks to the Avenger, we managed to uncover the Dolg's plans for Skadovsk. The Avenger would have told you a lot more about it, but unfortunately he's dead. .
See how. What's the information?. .
Listen and remember: the Dolg saboteurs, namely Varg hired the bandits, are due to attack Skadovsk any day now. And it will be not some rabble with "Makarovs" and "rip-offs", but well equipped and organized forces - dolgovtsy organized their arms supply, it seems some Morgan was engaged in it. In short, we need to urgently gather all combat-ready loners to defend the ship.. .
Wow, wow... When I refused to set up the Dolga base here, I had no idea it would turn out like this... That's a load of crap! Yes, our affairs are bad... And now the stalkers who are more experienced are reaching for Jupiter, there's nothing for them here any more - boredom is deadly, there are almost no artifacts. So it turns out that the only stalkers we have left for defence are very green ones, they're just kids, and some of them don't even know how to shoot good enough... But wait a minute... Exactly! There are three rather large and well-armed groups of experienced stalkers camping nearby. I've done them a favour recently, so it's about time they worked it off. So: find the leaders of these groups - Maple, Falcon and Granite, they usually try to walk alone so as not to attract attention - tell the situation and order them to come to "Skadovsk" at night, I think these things just then in the attack will fly. The coordinates of these stalkers I sent you on the DA.. .
Hello. Is there a case?. .
Yes, exactly. There's no time to explain everything in detail, so get the gist: Beard said that as payment for that service, you should do the following. Skadovsk will be attacked by bandits, and if you help us fight back, you'll get what you owe. So gather your people and you will be at "Skadovsk" by nightfall, if anything is unclear, Beard will explain everything on the spot. .
Lady, I've got three more with me - everyone will be on time. .
First_talking.
Goodbye. .
Oh, a stalker on the horizon! Why come?
I'm from Beard. He asks to be at Skadovsk by nightfall, it's very important.
Hmmm... What's that for? .
The Skadovsk will tell you everything. In general terms: the ship is to be attacked by bandits, and if you help in the defense - you will do Beard a favor for a favor.. .
You should have said so right away. Just take into account that most of our guys raided Jupiter, so there will only be three of us.
Also good..
Good luck.. .
And hello to you too.
My regards to you too. I have an important matter to you. Skadovsk is to be attacked by bandits, as a repayment of your debt Beard offers to help repel their attack. How do you agree?
Yes, only there's a problem. As of late I am no longer the group leader and unfortunately no one but me will come to the rescue. But I will try to be there before anyone else and delay the bandits on the way. .
But don't stay on your point too long-we don't want dead heroes.
And I'm not going to die.
I have spoken to the stalker commanders.
So what? Will they arrive by the deadline?
Yes, but there will only be eight.
Eight!? Fuck, then we're all going to get chopped up.
They will not. The main thing is to distribute people properly on positions and plenty of ammunition, then we will beat them off for sure.. .
Yeah, by the way, about the ammo, Klen sent a message - he says they're low on ammo: two rounds per brother. We can't hold out with that kind of ammo. Where am I gonna get ammo? I'm a bartender! Why don't you go to Rye?
Come on, friend, shovel your supplies.
I don't fucking get it. What do you want, goblin?
Knowledgeable people told me that you can get ammo from you. Skadovsk is to be attacked by bandits, and the defenders have a horn per brother. Would you mind sharing a box? Remember, the fate of the ship depends on it, don't be stingy.
Maybe the fate of the ship depends, but not mine - I'll get along with anyone. Share, of course, I can, but I'm afraid that I will not have much of myself after that. All right, I'll give it to you, but I want you to do some work for me. Anyway, listen, there's been a gang of thugs around here lately. Bitchy bitches like you. Okay, there's not a lot of scumbags in the Zone, but here's the thing: they tracked down the routes my shuttles take, and they're going after them. I'm already in the 4th day of sitting on the old stockpile, not one has not yet reached me with the goods. If you kill these thugs, it's all right, the box of ammo is yours. Now I'll send you their approximate coordinates - and go hero. .
OK, I will. Otherwise, this gang will still show up at night - it makes sense to bring them down before..
That's a good point you made. All the guys around went crazy - they are preparing for an attack, and they did not have a chance to live like that. .
All right, I've killed those thieves.
Somebody's Rambo... All right, relax, you helped my business, well done. Now for the reward. Like I told you, I'm sitting on old supplies, I don't have enough ammo for a box. In short, look: I used the PDA of one of the recently killed leaders of the bandits to get information about the approximate location of the cache, where they hid the stolen goods. There should be enough ammo there to arm a small army. So if you find the cache, it'll be yours. Just keep in mind, there are only approximate coordinates near Emerald. Well, good luck to you.
Fuck! It's never like that with you.
And the fucking business. Get the fuck out of here....
I think there's plenty of ammo here.
Good, that's what we've been missing the most, but there will be another errand. I've been rummaging around in my stash and found a few sets of C-4 explosives. I've had them since I was a stalker. So I consulted with Granit - he said that it would do us good to mine the approaches to "Skadovsk" to make it easier to defend. He advised me to disguise mines as ordinary stalker backpacks. A few newcomers had already hidden them in the most important routes to Skadovsk. All that's left is to plant the explosives. Will you do it? .
Yes, of course. It won't be superfluous, only who will undermine them afterwards?.
Don't worry about that. Granit has decided to personally lead the defence and he'll make sure the mines go off when they're needed - at the most opportune moment. .
All, I've mined all approaches to the ship.
Well done! Now everything is done to repel the bandits.
When do you think they'll get in?. .
We'll wait for their attack. While you were gone, our guys caught one of their scouts, and before they shot him, he said that they will attack at night, at 3 o'clock, or even earlier, then come to me - I need to tell you something. .
Comrade Colonel, no new information from headquarters?
Why hasn't it come in? There is information, Major. There is another opportunity to understand what is really going on here and how to resolve the situation.
I am listening to you carefully, Comrade Colonel.
So, Major. The current situation does not satisfy the command. It believes that such high Sin group activity could not have arisen out of nothing. At the headquarters there is a clear link between the recent events, and we will have to determine the cause, the root cause of the problem. .
Do you think this is solely about a sectarian group?
No, they're just another performer. However, I can't get the gist of one report from our agent, that perhaps the sinners were acting in concert with the monoliths. This information is still unverified, but it's not up to that now either. Command believes that the time is not right to seriously deal with the problem of sinners - there are more important issues, and the resolution of this problem can be directly linked to the activities of the clan "Sin". .
What exactly is the case? And why do you think sectarians are involved in all the recent events? .
I didn't say so. No one is entirely sure of that. Maybe they are not. But in general I will tell you the essence of the problem first, and then we will draw conclusions. Because I see you do not quite understand what we're talking about.
good.
It goes like this: we received a tip from one of our own among the traders, saying that long ago in the Zone, even before the disaster may have been working on the creation of biological weapons. Information is unfortunately too little. The agent was unable to find out the name of the project, nor where it took place. There is only scrappy information associated with the fact that this weapon could represent a virus that completely changes the DNA structure of any living organism, forcing it to mutate in the most unpredictable way.
Spontaneous mutations? What do you think is the correct version of man-made mutants? .
Are you not, Major? So this information didn't just leak out from somewhere - not over a glass of vodka in a bar. It has recently come to light that the mercenaries have taken an interest in the scientists' findings all of a sudden. I'm not telling you, you know that yourself. In addition remains a mystery such a strong their activity in Pripyat near the lab X-8..
Yeah, I've been racking my brain on that question myself. Mercenaries wouldn't just go in there.
I mean the same thing. Here's the deal. From the scouts just got a report that they saw one of the blue, which again grated near the "Jubilee" BWC. The guys reckoned he was trying to find the entrance to the Eighth. He was working alone, probably one of the top pros. Weapons and gear are the best. Only the guys did not see: whether he went back from the BWC, most likely it was there to meet the monoliths, although not for sure. So you'd better go check it out. .
Can't you make contact with him if you don't?
With the blue one, and you don't have to. You can remove it, just bring it to me, and then I will decide what to do. .
The mercenary is dead. A very strange death: doesn't look like a monolith - not a single wound on the body. No anomalies nearby, no mutants encountered either. Here is his PDA. .
You say strange death. All right, let's take note. Well, let's see. Oh, there's mention of a certain Project Source. Interesting, so it's the soul of the group Serbin brought here, it turns out that the mercenaries were looking for something in the lab is related to this project, only it is unclear whether they found or not. The message makes it clear that its sender managed to get there, and that's bad enough. It turns out that the mercenaries were one step ahead of us after all. .
But maybe they haven't had time to turn in their order yet, because they still have to leave Pripyat.
I really hope so. Ok, I need to find out more about this project first. I'll try to run it through our channels. I suggest you interview some of the local custodians. I think they might be able to provide some leads.
OK, I'll see what I can do.
Friend, need your help.
Yes, and how can I help you?
I need any information regarding the so-called Project Source. Do you know anything about it?
Project Source you say. Interesting. Well, let's just say I've heard something. I think you'd be interested to hear about it, too. Just keep in mind that the information I have at this time is not entirely verified and I cannot say with certainty that it is exactly what you are looking for. But these are very interesting facts. .
Don't be stingy, spell it out.
Mostly, this information was brought to me by a stalker named Enoch-maybe you've heard of him. They say he saved a lot of stalkers from different clans, which were cut off in Pripyat after the failed storm of Chernobyl. So I can't give you the papers, but I will read you something particularly important. Listen. .
I'm all ears.
"October 18. ...Around midnight we - a group of scientists captured or recruited at different times and in different parts of the world - were brought to a certain staging post. It was a long journey. Everyone is treated the same. Both those who work for money and those who are intimidated, whose families have been taken hostage. I am scared. The overlay of civility was too thin. At first we, each of us individually, were driven to an animal state by constant threats, public torture and mockery. Some of us could not bear the physical pain. Others, brave enough to talk about their importance in the scientific world and the special services, which would surely save them, snapped and lost hope. In Central Africa, in the temporary staging area where we met for the first time, many perked up. After a long period of isolation, everyone felt much better: we, broken all by ourselves, dreamed that together we would be able to think of a way to escape, or at least to make known the plight in which we found ourselves. The camp is guarded by mercenaries. They are totally unsociable, but subject to brutal discipline. Any breach is punishable by death. I look at them and think: our governments could have had a different policy. Instead of leading the world into ruin and chaos, wasting billions on political intrigue and blatant adventure, they should have been concerned about the general welfare and education of the peoples inhabiting the Earth. After what has been done to me, such thoughts do not seem naive. The senseless abuse to which I have been subjected has not only destroyed my will, but erased many illusions. We are doomed. The world is doomed. I do not know what goals the non-humans who have taken us over have, but they feel they are the absolute masters of the situation. Using the technical achievements of civilisation, they don't give a damn about any of the laws of the civilised world. I am scared. A brute, bestial force breaks the thin walls of consciousness, destroys illusions and creates a persistent sense of hopelessness. I ask myself: why and how was this possible? The answer is simple and floats to the surface: half a century of double standards and blatant double-dealing has created an illusion of impunity for many groups operating under the wings of a number of governments. We ourselves have nurtured a new strain of the plague. A moral plague. This can be seen particularly clearly from here, from the bottom of the abyss into which we have had to fall. October 25th. Keeping a diary. My past horror is nothing compared to what I've just experienced. Our escape plan has been discovered. It turns out there were provocateurs among us. They had thrown everybody out of the barracks and lined us up in the dusty square, then the brutal mercenaries, on the orders of a pale, gaunt, European-looking "gentleman", had thrown every fifth man out of the ranks. They were shot before our eyes. My hands were trembling. I could hardly keep a stump of pencil in my fingers. They were killed without any pity, brutally, with pleasure. The bodies were left lying in the dust, and in a minute flies were swarming over them. I could no longer bear the constant moral pressure, the debilitating fear. The only form of protest I was capable of was these notes. If they are found, I will certainly be killed. It becomes horrible, sometimes I am ashamed of myself. I do not have the strength to die with dignity, throwing myself on the guard - the lust to live is too great in my mind. I don't understand why they need a geneticist. All my life I have devoted to the development of genetically modified plants, only began experiments on animals, grafting representatives of rare, endangered species some inherent qualities, which should help them to survive in the rapidly changing biosphere of the Earth. My resistance has finally been broken. For a year now, the incessant nightmare has continued. There is no more hope." It gets even more interesting from here on.
Well, nothing's clear yet, go on...
"November 14 (approx.) They're taking us somewhere. We are being transported in the filthy hold of an old, breathing ship. The conditions are inhuman. The constant rocking is maddening. The constant torment suggests self-inflicted torture. How much hardship can a person endure? Where is the point beyond which fear disappears, where hope for a mythical salvation ceases to thrive? Among those trapped in the cesspool-like hold I cannot see many familiar faces. Little by little I come to realise that we were being filtered there, in the camp. The number of specialists from different fields of knowledge was evidently too great to begin with. In the course of the elimination process, the toughest of the toughest were eliminated for the edification of the weak. A win-win tactic. No one would think of resisting any longer. Many have fallen into a complete depression. It would seem that if our tormentors are going to use our prisoners for scientific research or experiments, we must not be led into a state of complete apathy, indifference to our own fate. I fear we may be subjected to illegal drugs upon arrival. Not drugs. December. Our agony is over. The ship reaches the port of destination. Where we are and where we will be taken next is an absolute mystery. Fire hoses were lowered into the hold, we were stripped naked, our clothes turned to rags, pieces of soap were thrown in and water was turned on, and we were ordered to clean up. After washing, several mercenaries acted as barbers. We were shaved naked, again treated as if we were animals. Gradually I was beginning to get used to the state of existence. The past life was a dream, a delirium of an inflamed consciousness. Bales of clothes were waiting for us on the deck. Each one picked out his own things. A piercing, cold wind was blowing, so no one had to be whipped. The clothes were clean, worn, but of good quality. I tried to count how many of us were left. It came out that there were about a hundred of us. My consciousness, sobered by the icy wind, began to work again, coming out of the doom-like slumber. I tried to talk to the others, to find out something. The information is scanty and utterly joyless. There is a persistent rumour that we have been brought to one of the countries of the former Soviet Union. I have heard several times the opinion that our captivity and all the abuse we have endured were the work of the KGB. The latter seemed to me doubtful. Each of us has delusions of genius in our heads, but if we are honest and unbiased, we are no more than average experts. There are no geniuses among us. Good performers with a high level of specialized training, capable of picking up and successfully developing a certain idea. No more than that. Considering the scientific potential scattered by the vortex of perestroika and the hard times of the nineties all over the post-Soviet space I am coming to the conclusion that the local special services definitely do not need us. It's scary to think about, but the one advantage of all the countries of the region without exception is practically total powerlessness. It is easy to hide traces of any adventure here. Soon it will be the new year 2000. Millennium is coming. Is the predicted end of the world really coming?" Think about what's been going on. .
Fucking hell...
And then this: "December 25 (exactly).We were put on buses. The mercenaries are not hiding weapons. The road, at first paved, now resembles a country lane. We look out of the windows in silence. Behind them are bleak, grey landscapes. Winter without snow. Squalid villages drift by. I drifted off to sleep for a while. I woke up to a jolting sensation. Outside the dusk windows of the bus, I could see a chillingly unreal landscape: a dead city, deserted by its people. Our convoy moves slowly along one of the streets. My knowledge of Russian is enough to make out the letters on one of the signs. Street of Heroes of Stalingrad. Rare snowflakes fall from the sky, slowly circling. The mud is frozen, turning into bumps. I look around and everywhere I see signs of a suddenly stopped life, as if someone is projecting similar black and white photographs on the window: gloomy houses with their windows darkened, street lights not working, rusty cars with deflated tyres, shop windows behind which half-empty counters with remains of goods can be seen in the light of bus headlights, snow-covered playgrounds, swings squeaking in the wind, a doll left in a sand-pit... The bus ascends the hill. The contours of some fundamental buildings are vaguely outlined on the horizon. My neighbour, an expert in cybernetics, suddenly leans over and whispers in my ear: - This is the Chernobyl nuclear power plant. I have been visiting it since before the accident. We are now moving through Pripyat, the dead, abandoned city of power engineers. His whisper is scalding. The buses suddenly turn off and suddenly... We are driving down a ramp leading underground. A clammy terror grips me. You can imagine. .
How, did it all really happen?
Yeah, who knows. Here's more... "Timeless... I don't know how many months or years have passed since we were brought into the old, Soviet-built underground missile complex. The bunker zone, stretching for many kilometres, has become a haven for mind and body, but I have already lost track of time and have no hope for anything else. My hopes of escape or escape melted away as the meaning of the experiments being conducted here became clearer. Those who captured us and keep us underground hate Humanity, despise the civilisation that nurtured them. They are preparing for the apocalypse. The kinds of weapons being developed here surpass the most delusional and fantastic ideas. We're really being used as industrious artisans. Everyone's given a narrow scope of work. I now know that I am engaged in the development of other people's ideas, research stopped somewhere on the brink of a foul. The genetic changes made by the viruses created in the laboratories will spare no one. They serve to utterly annihilate the enemy, but before they perish, humans and certain species of pets, for which genetic virus strains are designed, will be endowed with extraordinary abilities and serve as weapons. The world will perish or change unrecognisably. Take dogs, for example. Here, in the dungeons of the bunker zone, two strains of virus have already been weaponised, altering the sensorics of their "human friends" and endowing them with unusual survivability and hypertrophied fury. Pseudo-dogs exhibit mental powers over an inferior sub-species, the so-called blind dogs, due to the changes they have made to their brain structure. They can control them. I am no longer afraid. I have become an accomplice not just in a crime, but in the preparation of a mass genocide of mankind. I don't understand what those behind the experiments are counting on. Are they so stupid or insane that they hope to survive? In other laboratories I have seen terrifying creatures created from humans. The most terrifying spawn of the experiments are the controllers. They are capable of influencing the psyche of other mutants, gathering them into battle groups. This is INHUMANITY at its most terrifying and cynical."
Yes, this diary is priceless, where did Enoch dig it up?
And it's a long story, maybe I'll tell you about it sometime later. Here's another listen - the most interesting "Timelessness. I was recently receiving reagents from a warehouse. A few kilometres away from the biology labs, there was a section for physicists. There I met an old man. He seemed vaguely familiar to me, and when we exchanged a few words with him, I was horrified to recognize a young and undoubtedly talented scientist whom I had met in a past life at a conference on synergetics and the formation of related branches of knowledge existing at the interface of different sciences. He did not seem to remember me. He had no personality left. Only the creepy fanaticism of a researcher. He speaks indecipherable, often and inappropriately rattling off incomprehensible terms. It's amazing how I had the courage and patience to talk to him. The creepiest thing is that I have managed to understand that he has almost completed the setup that suppresses a person's personality. Only primitive reflexes remain. He claims that another device being developed by a "related party" can be used to control enemy soldiers whose minds will be suppressed - for the time being, however, within a radius of a dozen kilometres at most. They become obedient, but not to the will of man or controller. They fall under the influence of a second emitter, controlled by a cybernetic system. Timelessness... I fear nothing any more. My life is over. I am morally dead, and physical suffering is no longer frightening. I think of the dead city we rode through once upon a time. Would the whole Earth turn into a vast graveyard, where mutants and cybernetic-led undead would reign? I suffered, feared, clung to life, wriggled like a worm. Now I am dead. My last wish is to do something to prevent the coming catastrophe. Until all the research is complete, until the strains of genetic viruses are brought to the point of stability where they can be put into action with the expectation of a hundred percent result, until the Burner and its mysterious component that controls the behaviour of people who have lost their own minds has passed its final tests, I have to do something. I couldn't live with dignity, but I finally found the strength to die. Releasing all the pseudo dogs and blind dogs in the lab. Might be able to get to the next sector and free some controllers. I've heard that the Exclusion Zone area around the Chernobyl nuclear power plant is controlled by one of the isolation forces. I hope they are not in collusion with the mercenaries and their masters guarding us. The dogs have broken out of their cages before - nobody will worry much at first, but when the mercenaries understand the scale of what has happened it will be too late. I hope so...".
No, I'm just speechless. Sure I've had documents confirming that experiments were conducted in the Zone in closed laboratories, but this is exactly what you won't find anywhere else. .
I was shaken myself when I read it. But unfortunately all this information cannot give you the main answer - what is the project "Source". Was the scientist whose diary was found by Enoch a participant of that project or did he work in a related but not less important one? In short, the information is insufficient. .
And what are you suggesting. Who else do you think might know about the project?
Well, let's say-Snitch.
Synch... Damn, I don't want to deal with that bald contraceptive so much anymore.
Me too, well what can I do. I think he will answer for all his sins.
Damn, don't remind me of "sinful."
Ah, have you had enough of these fanatics?
Better than the monoliths, though they are finished, but not that much.
Yeah, all right, talk to Raccoon, just take the money with you: he doesn't do anything for free like I do.
Yes, all right, have fun.
Hello.
Salam aleikum to you too.
Information.

About a secret project called "The Source".
There's hardly anything secret left in it-it's true, there's still a lot to think about.
How much? .
I don't have much information, or rather I can only give a tip, so fuck it - I'll tell you for free.
Fucking hell, what do I hear - Sych decided to share for free information - are you on the wrong side of the bed today?
Listen, Degtyarev, don't show off, or I might change my mind. It's just that you've really made a mess of things here - especially that story about the bandit attack. So consider it a little present from me.
Well, then I'm listening.
All I know about "The Source" is not much. It was one of the projects started here back after the first disaster. There was a lot going on back then. I know that scientists sent a big expedition especially for this project - but no one returned from it. But scientists certainly know more about it than I do - go to them. .

He and Broker used to be thick as thieves, but on his last raid Broker left without him. Broker's whole group perished in some dungeons - it seems in the overpass, but shortly before his death Broker managed to send Senka electronic data of some documents. And as it turned out later, it was exactly information about the Source project. It seems that Senka drank himself to death and did not even manage to look at the papers before selling them. Apparently now he did not care about it ....
Sad to hear that, of course, but so what about the project?
According to this information, Project Source is nothing more than a set of developments in the field of extreme medicine and genetics. Soldiers were to be inculcated with skills uncharacteristic of humans - super endurance, super speed, and so on. The essence of development - to create a virus, whose DNA would be built into the human and change it in the right way. However, the project was a fiasco - although experimental subjects get the desired properties, but they become completely uncontrollable. Because of that, the project was shut down and the prototypes and documentation were moved to an unknown location. It is also known that the development was carried out in a class X laboratory. That's all we know. .
Thank you for the information.

"to assist Object Zero in introducing trained people from the group" Sin "in the various armed groups permanently operating in the area, as well as in the ranks of ordinary stalkers to sabotage the activities of groups and prevent the advancement of stalkers to our positions. remotely reminiscent of a controller, but not quite, more human-like or something. They clearly weren't expecting me to show up, and to be honest I'm not entirely sure they're the ones who killed the monoliths. .
